0.title: Evolutionary Database Design: Managing Change and Scaling with the System
0.description: As systems scale to meet growing demands, databases must evolve alongside them to maintain performance and integrity. This document explores best practices for managing database changes, maintaining knowledge, and ensuring smooth integration. Topics covered include knowledge sharing, repository structuring, continuous integration, and database refactoring, with real-world examples illustrating their application.
0.spr_content: - Public asset management app crucial for city resource tracking faces scalability challenges.<hr />- Growth leads to increased user demands, complex datasets, and regulatory pressures.<hr />- Performance issues and inconsistency threaten data reliability and user confidence.<hr />- Database design may outgrow initial assumptions, necessitating schema adaptations.<hr />- Poor repository management complicates tracking changes, risking data consistency.<hr />- Integration issues arise as services may rely on conflicting database versions.<hr />- Refactoring must be handled carefully to avoid widespread system impacts.<hr />- Solutions to safeguard growth should focus on knowledge sharing, structured management, continuous integration, and controlled refactoring.<hr /><hr />Evolutionary Database Design:<hr />- Ensures efficient database changes without disrupting dependencies.<hr />- Knowledge sharing fosters collaboration between DBAs and developers.<hr />- Systematic repository structure enables consistent tracking of database changes.<hr />- Continuous integration automates verification to preclude schema conflicts.<hr />- Refactoring manages schema changes and modifications in database access.<hr /><hr />Knowledge Sharing:<hr />- DBAs gain understanding through experience and collaboration.<hr />- Centralized knowledge base documents schema changes, dependencies, and updates.<hr />- Regular sessions educate developers on best practices and current changes.<hr />- Impact assessments guide change requests to mitigate risks.<hr /><hr />Database Repository Structure:<hr />- Centralizes management of database changes systematically.<hr />- Components: <hr />  - Schema definitions & migrations via versioned scripts.<hr />  - Configuration & credentials for secure database access.<hr />  - Change documentation for traceability.<hr />  - Version control systems (e.g., Git) for tracking and rollback.<hr /><hr />Continuous Integration:<hr />- Follows structured verification for every change:<hr />  1. Compatibility testing on schema changes.<hr />  2. Data migrations validated to avoid corruption.<hr />  3. Notifications for conflicts pre-deployment.<hr /><hr />Database Refactoring:<hr />- Updates schema and data while ensuring minimal disruption.<hr />- Non-breaking changes (e.g., new columns) are safe.<hr />- Breaking changes require transitional phases to maintain service functionality.<hr />  <hr />Summary:<hr />- Effective evolution requires clear communication, structured documentation, and proactive conflict management.<hr />- Utilizing version control and automation preserves database integrity amid system growth.<hr />- A well-maintained database repository is key for operational consistency and development clarity.

1.title: Frontend Report February 2025
1.description: Our February 2025 report covers what's new in frontend development - from React's move away from Create React App to Next.js improvements, browser compatibility updates, and cool new tools like React Scan. Get practical tips for better auth, faster websites, and making your sites work for everyone.
1.spr_content: - Create React App (CRA) deprecated; outdated technology.<hr />- Alternatives: Vite for fast builds, Next.js for server rendering.<hr />- React Context can lead to performance issues; consider smaller contexts or state libraries (Jotai, Zustand).<hr />- React Server Components allow for data streaming; differentiate from regular components.<hr />- React Query has trade-offs: large file size, complexity in cache management.<hr />- Vercel's Fluid Compute reduces AI costs; efficient request handling.<hr />- Next.js 15 enhances error handling; introduced specialized error files.<hr />- Double-keyed caching affects site speed negatively; prioritize user privacy.<hr />- Enhance accessibility with proper HTML, form design, and focus management.<hr />- Speed optimization: image compression, Gzip, smart caching, critical CSS.<hr />- JavaScript trends in 2025: serverless platforms, WebAssembly, microfrontends.<hr />- "Interop 2025" aims for consistent browser feature compatibility; new priorities for standardization.<hr />- React Scan identifies performance bottlenecks easily; no code modification needed.<hr />- Nue framework offers simplicity and reduced JS complexity; focuses on web fundamentals.<hr />- Standard Schema improves upon Zod for validation; better performance and compatibility.<hr />- Commentary on technology shifts: server-side practices, developer frustrations with linters, and the evolution of HTML.

2.title: Micro Frontends Microservices For Frontend Development
2.description: Micro Frontends is an architectural style where independently deliverable frontend applications are composed into a greater whole.
2.spr_content: - Micro-frontend: Architectural style for independently deliverable frontend applications composing a larger system.<hr />- Benefits:<hr />  - Cohesive, maintainable, smaller codebases.<hr />  - Scalable organizations with decoupled teams.<hr />  - Incremental upgrades and rewrites of frontend components.<hr />  - Simplified maintenance via focused and specialized repositories.<hr />  <hr />- Micro frontends in action:<hr />  - Build-time Integration: Each micro frontend published as a package, included in container as dependencies.<hr />    - JavaScript example illustrates dependencies and versioning.<hr />  - Run-time Integration via iframes: Utilizes iframes to load micro frontends.<hr />    - Complexity in responsiveness and routing challenges.<hr />  - Run-time Integration via JavaScript: Scripts load micro frontends, exposing global functions.<hr />    - Container determines which function to execute for rendering.<hr />  - Run-time Integration via Web Components: Defines micro frontends as custom HTML elements.<hr />    - Instant instantiation of components, with issues in server-side rendering and browser support.<hr /><hr />- Cross-application communication methods:<hr />  - Custom events.<hr />  - Routing mechanisms.<hr /><hr />- Server-side rendering: Challenging, can use Server Side Includes for specific page content.<hr /><hr />- Conclusion:<hr />  - Dependency duplication increases payload size.<hr />  - Potential performance impacts.<hr />  - Requires a learning curve.<hr />  - Best suited for medium to large projects.<hr /><hr />- References:<hr />  - Micro frontends and related articles/resources for in-depth understanding.

3.title: Optimizing initial load time for a Trading Platform
3.description: Discover the technical strategies behind optimizing a Binance trading platform, reducing initial load times to under 1 second for enhanced trader productivity.
3.spr_content: - Optimized frontend performance for a trading platform targeting Binance traders.<hr />- Primary issue: long initial load times, worsening with more accounts.<hr />- Sluggish performance negatively affected real-time trading responsiveness.<hr />- Achieved initial content display in under 1 second; full usability in approx. 1.5 seconds (improved from 2.5-3 seconds).<hr />- Importance of speed: traders need fast, real-time processing, often managing 50+ accounts.<hr />- Frontend performs real-time calculations but requires frequent page refreshes for updates, leading to delays.<hr />- Performance challenges: slow network connections and high rendering workload.<hr />- Slow network issue: excessive requests to Binance per account; hundreds of requests for many accounts.<hr />- Limitation of browser requests contributes to load time increases.<hr />- Slow rendering workload: large code to process and style; browser delays over 1 second.<hr />- Initial strategy: process data in background, but background worker delay proved problematic.<hr />- Focus shifted to reducing network delays and data handling at the outset.<hr />- Key Strategies:<hr />  - Enhanced backend API speed through caching, request batching, data compression, and combined WebSocket setup.<hr />  - Caching account data to minimize repetitive requests.<hr />  - Request batching to consolidate multiple account data requests into one.<hr />  - Data compression for faster transfers.<hr />  - Including WebSocket setup (`listenKey`) in the initial response to speed real-time connections.<hr />  - Caching processed data to skip background worker delays at initial load.<hr />  - Quickly revalidating data with a non-blocking call after displaying initial data.<hr />- Result: transformed a slow-loading platform into a fast, responsive tool.<hr />- Showed significant efficiency gains: initial display under 1 second and full usability in 1.5 seconds, amplifying trader satisfaction. <hr />- Conclusion emphasizes practical solutions (caching, batching, optimizing updates) over complex theories for effective performance enhancement in trading platforms.

4.title: Building a complete tech system for small Vietnamese hotels
4.description: We helped Aharooms create a suite of digital tools that enables small hotels in Vietnam to improve operations, increase bookings, and boost revenue, especially during the challenging COVID-19 period when adaptation was crucial.
4.spr_content: - **Industry Context**: Hospitality in Vietnam; focus on small hotels (2-3 stars).<hr />- **Business Goal**: Develop tech tools to enhance competitiveness and adapt to challenges, especially post-COVID-19.<hr />- **Product Solution**: Integrated system with booking platform, management tools, revenue optimization features.<hr />- **Outcome**: Successful launch; gained market recognition; enabled small hotels to thrive during COVID.<hr />- **Technical Contributions**: Full-stack development; expertise in product development.<hr /><hr />### Technical Highlights:<hr />- **Backend**: Golang, Elixir for robustness.<hr />- **Frontend**: React.js, JavaScript, TypeScript for interactivity and responsiveness.<hr />- **Infrastructure**: Docker, Google Cloud, Kubernetes, Netlify for scalability.<hr />- **Monitoring Tools**: Prometheus, Grafana, Loki, Sentry for system health.<hr />- **Database**: PostgreSQL, Redis for efficient data management.<hr />- **Architecture**: Monolithic design for speed and maintainability.<hr /><hr />### Challenges Identified:<hr />- Small Vietnamese hotels lack modern management solutions; inconsistent service and resources.<hr />- COVID-19 intensified need for digital adaptation and innovative business models.<hr />- Development hurdles with balancing new features and existing code fixes.<hr /><hr />### Development Strategy:<hr />- **Architecture**: Chose monolithic model for agility and simpler maintenance.<hr />- **Cloud Solutions**: Google Cloud setup with Docker and Kubernetes for data security and isolation.<hr />- **Performance**: Utilizing Netlify to prevent traffic bottlenecks, ensuring rapid user experience.<hr />- **QA Process**: Rigorous testing with multiple development environments for reliability.<hr />- **Data Insights**: Integrated PostgreSQL and Metabase for performance analytics.<hr /><hr />### Key Features Developed:<hr />- **Management Tools**:<hr />  - Booking platform similar to "Shopify for hotels."<hr />  - Centralized property management system (PMS).<hr />  - Daily operation and budget management tools.<hr />- **Customer Retention**:<hr />  - Loyalty system via "Ahacoin" for cashback rewards.<hr />  - Performance metrics visualization.<hr />  - Cancellation analysis for operational improvements.<hr />- **Revenue Optimization**:<hr />  - Advanced revenue management system (RMS).<hr />  - Integration with multiple booking platforms.<hr />  - Flexible booking options support.<hr /><hr />### Collaborative Approach:<hr />- Functioned as dedicated product team for Aharooms.<hr />- Regular workshops to align with Vietnamese hotel owners’ needs.<hr />- Agile feature adjustments based on market feedback.<hr />- Comprehensive support from design to deployment.<hr /><hr />### Achievements:<hr />- Launched a market-recognized product; positioned Aharooms as an industry innovator.<hr />- Developed a scalable platform with multiple revenue streams.<hr />- Simplified operations for hotel owners; enabled online bookings during COVID-19.<hr />- Created mechanisms for improved customer retention and revenue maximization.<hr /><hr />### Impact:<hr />- Empowered Aharooms to establish market presence and anticipated growth post-pandemic.<hr />- Facilitated significant operational enhancements for small hotel clientele, driving recovery and future resilience.

5.title: Redesigning BHD Cinema's ticket booking app for a better experience
5.description: We helped BHD Cinema transform their outdated mobile app into an intuitive platform that allows customers to easily browse movies, book tickets online, and enjoy a seamless cinema experience, turning movie-goers into loyal BHD fans.
5.spr_content: **Industry**: Entertainment  <hr />**Location**: Vietnam  <hr />**Business Context**: Popular cinema chain, frustrated users due to outdated, non-functional app.  <hr />**Solution**: Complete app redesign; intuitive user flows for ticket booking and movie discovery.  <hr />**Outcome**: Modern, easy-to-use app enhancing cinema experience for movie-goers.  <hr />**Service Provided**: Mobile app design / UI/UX improvement.  <hr /><hr />**Technical Highlights**:  <hr />- **UI Framework**: Modern mobile design frameworks implemented.  <hr />- **Typography**: Utilized Avenir Next font family for clarity.  <hr />- **Design System**: Established consistent components and cohesive color palette.  <hr />- **Interactive Elements**: Features like carousel navigation and user-friendly booking screens.  <hr /><hr />**Client**: BHD Cinema, leading in ticket sales in Vietnam, faced major digital experience challenges with an outdated app lacking online booking capability.  <hr /><hr />**Challenge**:  <hr />- Outdated visuals and interface inconsistencies.  <hr />- Inability for online ticket bookings.  <hr />- Poor navigation due to cluttered design.  <hr />- Essential information missing for customers.  <hr />- Desired transformation of user perception and loyalty cultivation.  <hr /><hr />**Design Approach**:  <hr />- Focused on core movie-goer needs for usability and aesthetics.  <hr />- **Intuitive Navigation**: Home screen showcases movies prominently; promotional content minimized.  <hr />- **Simplified Information**: Clear movie details with accessible booking button.  <hr />- **Streamlined Booking**: Reduced booking process steps with logical groupings of showtimes.  <hr />- **Digital Convenience**: Introduced digital tickets with QR codes; historical booking management system.  <hr /><hr />**Key Features**:  <hr />- **Home Screen & Movie Schedule**: User-friendly layout emphasizing movie content; improved carousel for browsing.  <hr />- **Movie Details**: Structured for quick interest evaluation; comprehensive film information included.  <hr />- **Showtime Selection**: Organized by date, location, and type, minimizing overload, emphasizing Today's shows.  <hr />- **Booking Flow**: Simplified and intuitive; quick reservation steps.  <hr />- **Transaction History**: Easy tracking of current and past bookings; digital tickets for entry efficiency.  <hr />- **Cinema Browsing**: "Book by cinema" feature enhances selection flexibility.  <hr />- **Theater Information**: Detailed descriptions and visuals of theater types enhancing customer expectations.  <hr /><hr />**Achievements**:  <hr />- Transformed user experience through an intuitive interface.  <hr />- Enabled online ticket bookings, reducing waiting times.  <hr />- Implemented digital ticket management and booking history system.  <hr />- Presented comprehensive, digestible movie and theater information.  <hr />- Fostered brand loyalty by enhancing customer engagement digital experience.  <hr />- Competitively positioned BHD Cinema in Vietnam's entertainment market.

6.title: Building a powerful crypto trading dashboard for professionals
6.description: We built Hedge Foundation, a powerful crypto trading dashboard that helps professional traders manage multiple accounts, track positions, and automate order execution in real-time across exchanges.
6.spr_content: - **Industry Context**: Financial Technology / Cryptocurrency; Global reach.<hr />- **User Need**: Unified system for professional crypto traders; managing multiple exchange accounts; executing strategies efficiently.<hr />- **Solution Developed**: Comprehensive all-in-one dashboard; synchronizes data across exchanges; automates trading functions.<hr />- **Outcome Achieved**: Significant reduction in management time for multiple trading accounts.<hr /><hr />- **Service Offerings**: <hr />  - Full-stack development.<hr />  - Financial system integration.<hr />  - Advanced data visualization.<hr /><hr />- **Technical Highlights**:<hr />  - **Performance**: Utilized AG Grid for handling large data tables with real-time updates.<hr />  - **Concurrency**: Implemented web workers for background processes, ensuring UI responsiveness.<hr />  - **Backend**: Developed using Elixir and Phoenix framework for robust API performance.<hr />  - **Data Collection**: Employed crawling systems utilizing Elixir’s Supervisor and GenServer for efficient data gathering.<hr />  - **Visualization Tools**: Integrated TradingView with custom indicators for tailored market analysis.<hr />  - **Architecture**: Designed as microservices with dedicated Balancer and Forwarder for data management.<hr /><hr />- **Case Study: Hedge Foundation**:<hr />  - Developed a trading dashboard for crypto traders to manage accounts, track positions, monitor balances, calculate PnL, and execute bulk orders efficiently.<hr />  - Addressed challenges such as data fragmentation, manual monitoring, execution speed, visualization deficiencies, and historical analysis needs.<hr />  <hr />- **Innovative Features**:<hr />  - Alarm system for real-time market notifications.<hr />  - Automated trading for rapid execution of strategies.<hr />  - Database for extensive historical data storage.<hr />  - Custom charting capabilities with user-defined indicators.<hr /><hr />- **Development Methodology**:<hr />  - Optimized for real-time performance and reliability.<hr />  - Engaged in continuous collaboration with founder for domain expertise.<hr />  - Weekly discussions, daily stand-ups, and collaborative tools (Discord, Basecamp, GitHub) to ensure aligned development.<hr /><hr />- **Achievement Summary**:<hr />  - Delivered a platform facilitating real-time monitoring and automated alerts.<hr />  - Enabled streamlined trade execution and comprehensive historical data for strategy optimization.<hr />  - Reduced management complexity; provided centralized oversight for traders.<hr />  - Continual expansion of integrations with more trading platforms to enhance user capabilities.<hr />  <hr />- **Value Proposition**: Demonstrated capability in creating complex financial systems that integrate real-time data, tailored visualizations, and automated workflows in the cryptocurrency trading domain.

7.title: Building a central hub for food and beverage businesses in Singapore
7.description: We helped Momos, a pre-seed startup in Singapore, build their first MVP, a centralized data hub that simplifies online operations for food and beverage businesses through third-party integrations and data analytics.
7.spr_content: - **Industry**: Food & Beverage Technology in Singapore.<hr />- **Business Context**: Pre-seed startup (Momos) required rapid MVP development for market fit testing.<hr />- **Solution**: Centralized data platform integrating delivery services and analytics.<hr />- **Outcome**: Platform launched; first users onboarded successfully.<hr />- **Services Provided**: Full-stack development, integration development, DevOps.<hr />  <hr />### Technical Highlights:<hr />- **Backend**: Node.js for rapid development flexibility.<hr />- **Frontend**: React and Next.js for responsive UI.<hr />- **Database**: PostgreSQL with materialized views for reporting.<hr />- **Cloud Architecture**: AWS Lambda, EventBridge, CloudWatch for serverless infrastructure.<hr />- **Authentication**: Auth0 with OAuth 2.0 for secure access.<hr />- **Analytics**: Google Studio for visualization and reporting.<hr /><hr />### Partnership with Momos:<hr />- Founded by ex-Grab employee; simplifies online operations for F&B businesses.<hr />- Centralized hub for managing online presence across multiple services.<hr />- Onboarded a team of three developers remotely starting March 2021.<hr />- Development aimed to establish a future-proof, scalable foundation.<hr /><hr />### Challenge Faced:<hr />- F&B sector saw increased online operations during the pandemic, leading to fragmentation.<hr />- Businesses had to juggle multiple delivery platforms and social media accounts.<hr />- Lack of a unified view hindered data-driven decision-making.<hr />  <hr />### Solution Features:<hr />- **Third-party Integrations**: APIs for Grab, Foodpanda, Deliveroo; unified dashboard.<hr />- **Serverless Architecture**: Cost-efficient, automatic scaling, high availability.<hr />- **Report Generation**: Utilized GPT-3 for natural language summaries and custom reporting templates.<hr />- **Authentication System**: Ensured secure data synchronization and access.<hr /><hr />### Collaborative Approach:<hr />- Engineers distributed across Singapore, India, and Vietnam.<hr />- Clear communication channels: Daily sync-ups, Notion for task management, weekly logs.<hr />- Development emphasized rapid prototyping, iteration, and documentation.<hr /><hr />### Achievements:<hr />- Successful MVP launch; solid foundation for F&B management.<hr />- Features enable merchants to:<hr />  - Manage multi-platform delivery.<hr />  - Track online reputation.<hr />  - Deploy advertising campaigns easily.<hr />  - Generate data-driven business insights.<hr />- Key technical achievements:<hr />  - Scalable integration framework.<hr />  - Reliable data synchronization.<hr />  - Intuitive user interface.<hr />  - Automated reporting to save time.<hr /><hr />### Future Collaboration:<hr />- Ongoing partnership focuses on enhancing analytics and review management capabilities.<hr />- Aims to add value to users and accelerate growth in the F&B marketplace.

8.title: Building a community platform for Vietnamese Entrepreneurs
8.description: We helped create a digital hub where Vietnamese startup founders can connect, share knowledge, and access resources to grow their businesses.
8.spr_content: - **Industry Context**: Startup community and knowledge sharing in Vietnam; need for connection among entrepreneurs, investors, and resources.<hr />- **Solution**: Developed a comprehensive online community platform for Vietnamese startups.<hr />- **Impact**: Attracted thousands of users; facilitated valuable networking and resource sharing.<hr />  <hr />- **Service Overview**: Full-stack development focusing on a community platform with search integration.<hr />  <hr />- **Technical Highlights**:<hr />  - **Backend**: Node.js and Express for flexible API.<hr />  - **Frontend**: React.js and Next.js for responsive UX.<hr />  - **Database**: MongoDB for diverse content storage.<hr />  - **Search**: Elasticsearch for efficient content discovery.<hr />  - **Architecture**: Microservices for independent scalability.<hr />  - **Mobile Optimization**: Responsive design focused on smartphone users.<hr />  - **Security**: Strong authentication and permissions.<hr /><hr />- **Challenges Addressed**:<hr />  - **Information Fragmentation**: Resources dispersed across platforms.<hr />  - **Limited Networking**: Barriers for founders outside urban centers.<hr />  - **Knowledge Shortages**: New founders lacking mentorship and practical guidance.<hr /><hr />- **Development Strategy**:<hr />  - Built platform tailored to user needs and experiences.<hr />  - Engaged with StartupVN team for real-time feedback.<hr />  - Ensured fast, engaging user navigation and community features.<hr />  <hr />- **Key Features**:<hr />  - Forums for discussion and knowledge sharing.<hr />  - Event listings for networking.<hr />  - Resource libraries for guidance.<hr />  - User profiles for showcasing work.<hr />  - Mentorship connections linking experienced founders to newcomers.<hr /><hr />- **Achievements**:<hr />  - Rapid community growth and active user engagement.<hr />  - Improved access to resources for rural founders.<hr />  - Successful matches of startups with mentors and investors.<hr />  <hr />- **Future Growth**: Continuous updates and feature enhancements driven by community feedback; integral to Vietnam's startup ecosystem evolution. <hr /><hr />- **Quote**: "The platform has transformed how we support entrepreneurs in Vietnam." - Tuan Anh, Founder of StartupVN.<hr />  <hr />- **Conclusion**: Project exemplifies the role of digital platforms in empowering entrepreneurial communities and fostering economic development.

From beachside workspaces to anime figurine collections, we've got it all.

14.title: Collaboration Guideline
14.description: guidelines for project collaboraton DF and Client
14.spr_content: - **Project Collaboration Guidelines**: Structure for teamwork between Development Firm (DF) and Clients.<hr />- **Tools**:<hr />  - Project management: Basecamp.<hr />  - Sprint management: Jira/Basecamp.<hr />  - Communication: Google Meet.<hr />  - Source control: Github/Gitlab.<hr />  - Design tools: Figma/Sketch.<hr />  <hr />- **Schedule**:<hr />  - Kick-off meeting: 1 session.<hr />  - Sprint duration: 1 to 2 weeks.<hr />  - Planning and review meetings: 1 per sprint.<hr />  - Daily standups: As needed via Basecamp or communication channel.<hr />  - Feedback meetings: Weekly or bi-weekly with Account Manager.<hr />  - Meeting notes: Disseminated within 30 minutes post-meeting.<hr /><hr />- **Workflow**:<hr />  - **Project Management**:<hr />    - All members engage in Sprint planning.<hr />    - Document milestones/features on Jira/Basecamp.<hr />    - New features/requests placed in Icebox/Backlog for future sprints.<hr />    - Bugs prioritized for current Sprint based on assessment.<hr />    - Aim for “Potentially Shippable” software in every Sprint.<hr />    - Bi-weekly review meeting for progress and conflict resolution.<hr /><hr />  - **Design & Development Collaboration**:<hr />    - Design: Provide color palette, font sizes, base components.<hr />    - Design review by development prior to sprints.<hr /><hr />  - **Backend & Frontend Integration**:<hr />    - Essential: API documentation, development/staging/production environments.<hr />    - CORS enabled on API.<hr />    - Agreement on glossary, naming conventions, and data schema within first Sprint.<hr /><hr />  - **Quality Assurance**:<hr />    - Bugs must include reproduction steps, affected platforms, and severity level.<hr />    - Dedicated testing environments for frontend features before merging.<hr /><hr />- **Release Process**:<hr />  - Releases occur at Sprint's end, with hotfixes as needed.<hr />  - Include semantic versioning, release notes, and known issues.<hr />  - Individual releases per Backend, Frontend, or microservice.<hr /><hr />- **Customer Feedback**:<hr />  - Response through direct message, email, or calls.<hr />  - Direct feedback to specific project team members based on areas (e.g., implementation, progress).<hr /><hr />- **Issue Management**:<hr />  - Timely response based on severity levels (Critical to Minor), with dedicated response channels and timings:<hr />    - Critical: 10 min response, 30 min resolve.<hr />    - Major: 30 min response, 2-5 hr resolve.<hr />    - Moderate: 45 min response, 7 hr resolve.<hr />    - Minor: 1 day response, 1 day resolve.<hr />  - Commitment to respond to all queries within 24 hours.

15.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
15.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object.
15.spr_content: - Atomic Object employs Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) strategy for custom software development.<hr />- Complexity of software projects complicates pricing.<hr />- Traditional strategies: "Fixed Price" and "Time And Materials."<hr />  <hr />### Fixed Price<hr />- Total project cost locked upfront.<hr />- Static: Scope, Cost; Flexible: Quality.<hr />- Assumes accurate estimates; risk transferred to consultant.<hr />- Conflict arises over scope changes; new ideas typically excluded.<hr />- Vendor risks losing money if project exceeds initial estimate; incentivizes rigidity.<hr />- Risk of building incorrect product due to fixed parameters.<hr /><hr />### Time And Materials<hr />- Vendor charges for every hour worked; no financial constraints.<hr />- Static: Scope, Quality; Flexible: Cost, Timeline.<hr />- Client assumes financial risk; vendor has no budget incentives.<hr />- Potential for unchecked scope creep, lacking visibility on project progress.<hr />- Clients may hesitate to modify scope due to budget concerns; vendors welcome changes.<hr />  <hr />### Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC)<hr />- Combines strengths of both models, minimizing weaknesses.<hr />- Establish upfront budget without fixed scope.<hr />- Static: Budget, Quality; Flexible: Scope.<hr />- Assumption: Budget limits creativity; prioritizing best product outcomes.<hr />- Shared risk between client and consultant.<hr />- Regular reassessment of scope allows adaptation to new information.<hr />- Weekly project updates provide budget transparency and progress tracking.<hr />- Flexibility enhances product relevance; scope adjustments don't necessitate budget increases.<hr />- Collaboration fosters a better working relationship and improved final product.

16.title: Pricing model: Bill by hours
16.description: A new hourly billing model is introduced to ensure fair compensation for effort, flexibility in project scope, control over additional work, and transparency with clients.
16.spr_content: - Current environment: uncertain economy, tech market funding winter, cautious tech budgeting, layoffs common.<hr />- Upside: Companies seek end-to-end solutions, not just coding.<hr />- Expanded role of Dwarves: offering research, business analysis, consulting, solution design.<hr />- Transition to hourly billing model driven by: <hr />  - Fair compensation for actual work and expertise.<hr />  - Flexibility to adapt to project needs and client requirements.<hr />  - Control over additional billing for unforeseen challenges.<hr />  - Transparency through detailed time logging increases trust with clients.<hr />  <hr />### Implementation Steps:<hr />- **Clear announcement**: Inform clients of new timesheet approval process and time tracking.<hr />- **Timesheet setup**: Collaborate with clients to establish appropriate formats.<hr />- **Time tracking**: Utilize Notion/Excel for accurate hour logs; timely recording mandatory.<hr />- **Project management**: Maintain detailed plans; keep clients updated on progress and scope changes.<hr />- **Approval**: Submit monthly timesheets for client approval before invoicing.<hr /><hr />- Consistency and articulation are key for success in this model.<hr />- Building a habit of clear communication fosters stronger client relationships.<hr />- Operations team available for inquiries and support.

17.title: Low-fidelity prototype: UI Design
17.description: Design systems enable teams to build better products faster by making design reusable, reusability makes scale possible.
17.spr_content: - **Understanding Prospect**: Analyze stakeholders, business models, goals, and challenges; ensure alignment on design elements like mindset, style, color palette, typography, iconography, illustration, and photography.<hr />  <hr />- **Defining Product Elements**:<hr />  - **Style**: Establish layout style aligned with target users; reference platforms like Dribbble and Behance for trends.<hr />  - **Color**: Define primary and secondary colors; utilize apps like Milanote for moodboarding; apply the 6:3:1 rule and limit to 3 primary colors for visual harmony.<hr />  - **Typography**: Specify typeface and styles (header, subheader, body) including font-size and weight.<hr />  - **Iconography**: Create icons reflective of branding; select icon colors from established color palette.<hr />  - **Illustrations and Images**: Apply visual elements consistent with content and style; use bitmap masks for file exports.<hr />  - **Platform Consideration**: Detail specific screens (desktop, mobile, tablet) and implement grid layouts to optimize designs.<hr />  - **Responsive Design**: Ensure adaptability across devices; consider user requirements for responsiveness.<hr /><hr />- **Demo Design**: Produce preliminary screens for client review; if color palette is undecided, start with grayscale focus to emphasize layout, text, and spacing.<hr /><hr />- **Design System**:<hr />  - **Definition**: A design system is a collection of reusable components guided by standards, fostering scalability and product development speed.<hr />  - **Building Steps**:<hr />    - Align teams on shared goals to establish vision and communication.<hr />    - Create design principles as guiding references.<hr />    - Initiate color palette development with moodboards and systematic naming conventions; implement and test colors to comply with accessibility standards (WCAG).<hr />    - Detail typographic rules: sizes, spaces, fonts, and usage guidelines.<hr />    - Standardize graphic assets, including icons, photography, and branding images to ensure brand consistency.<hr />    - Catalog design components in a pattern library by function (e.g., navigation) and states (e.g., hover).<hr />  <hr />- **High-Fidelity Prototype**:<hr />  - **Description**: Create interactive UIs allowing user interaction (e.g., button presses, sliders).<hr />  - **Timing**: Develop post-UI design completion.<hr />  - **Goals**: Validate design assumptions, present concepts to developers/customers, gather feedback for future iterations.<hr />  - **Tools**: Utilize Principle, Protopie, and Adobe XD for prototyping.

18.title: Onboarding
18.description: What we have to do when a new employee come to our team.
18.spr_content: - Employee onboarding as gradual perspective formation.<hr />- Commitment decision to company during this stage.<hr />  <hr />**Important Onboarding Notes:**<hr />- Initiate onboarding from the first day.<hr />- Avoid unclear expectations and policies.<hr />- Reject one-size-fits-all methods.<hr />- Involve all relevant teams, not just direct departments.<hr />- Onboarding duration should exceed one week.<hr />- Maintain post-onboarding follow-up.<hr /><hr />**Offer Email Essentials:**<hr />- Include net/gross salary details.<hr />- Specify onboarding start date.<hr /><hr />**Onboarding Email Requests:**<hr />- Set up Transferwise account.<hr />- Provide identity card information.<hr />- Submit insurance details.<hr />- Complete fortress form.<hr />- Sign LLC contract.<hr />- Create onboarding schedule.<hr />- Join Dwarves Foundation Discord.<hr /><hr />**Operations Team Onboarding Call:**<hr />- Clarify position and daily workflow.<hr />- Present company benefits, paperwork essentials, and cultural expectations.<hr />  <hr />**Key Discussion Points:**<hr />- Define probation goals.<hr />- Introduce team, leaders, and projects.<hr />- Establish personal 60-day plan.<hr />- Detail workspace tools (Discord, Basecamp).<hr />- Explain reward system (ICY).<hr />- Set up crypto wallet and GitHub access.<hr />- Share daily report and communication protocols.<hr /><hr />**Membership Integration:**<hr />- Self-introduction on Discord including:<hr />  - Preferred name and role.<hr />  - Project involvement and personal goals.<hr />  - Tag teammates for a welcome.<hr />  <hr />**Team Lead Meeting:**<hr />- Outline 60-day probation guidelines.<hr />- Set goals and review schedule.<hr />- Introduce new hire to department head.<hr />- Assign a line manager for support.<hr />- Clarify work scope and expectations.<hr />- Establish bi-weekly check-ins focusing on culture fit and workflow.<hr />- Encourage sharing within the Dwarves community. <hr />- Foster engagement in technical discussions and mentorship opportunities.

19.title: Offer Letter
19.description: The email template is to annouce about new employment.
19.spr_content: - Title: Dwarves Foundation - Offer letter<hr />- Purpose: Employment offer notification<hr />- Recipient: [name]<hr />- Position: [position]<hr />- Interview Process: Candidate performed well<hr />- Fit: Candidate deemed a good match for the team<hr />- Employment Type: Full-time/Part-time<hr />- Office Hours: 9.30am - 6.30pm<hr />- Salary: [salary] VND/month (Gross)<hr />- Probation: [probation duration] months<hr />- Probation Salary: [salary] VND/month<hr />- Start Date: [start date time]<hr />- Contract Type: Signed with LLC<hr />- Action Required: Confirm acceptance by replying to the email<hr />- Additional Inquiry: Confirm suitability of start date<hr />- Anticipation: Excitement for candidate joining the team<hr />- Sender: Dwarves Foundation

20.title: Hiring Approach
20.description: Hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around.
20.spr_content: **Philosophy:**<hr />- Hire those who guide us; reverse roles are unfit.<hr />- Company culture stems from hiring, firing, and promotions.<hr />- Balance short-term evaluations with long-term vision.<hr />- Prioritize values and culture fit in hiring processes.<hr /><hr />**Principles:**<hr />1. Hiring signifies execution failure; seek assistance.<hr />2. Employee effectiveness in startups resembles a power distribution.<hr />3. Accept false positives; avoid false negatives.<hr />4. Culture is shaped by hiring choices.<hr />5. "A" players elevate workplace quality over superficial perks.<hr /><hr />**Heuristics:**<hr />- Favor strengths over weaknesses.<hr />- Consider potential trajectory over existing experience.<hr />- Seek doers, not just tellers.<hr />- Prioritize learners instead of experts.<hr />- Embrace diversity over sameness.<hr />- Bypass ego; attitude trumps skill.<hr />- Identify resilient individuals; obedience can hinder adaptability.<hr />- Assess habits; what you observe now persists.<hr />- A sense of humor indicates adaptability and engagement.<hr />- Fill skill gaps in existing teams; enhance diversity.<hr />- Maintain a "bullpen" of potential hires continuously.<hr />- Look for intellectual curiosity and communicative competence.<hr />- Emphasize the importance of diversity; widen recruitment strategies.<hr /><hr />**Protecting vs. Growing Culture:**<hr />- Hiring often serves to maintain existing cultures; avoid gatekeeping.<hr />- Embrace a dynamic culture that evolves with business growth.<hr />- Seek culture-adders, not just culture-fitters, to enhance dynamics.<hr /><hr />**Culture Add, Not Culture Fit:**<hr />- Culture fit is vital; avoid hiring identical candidates.<hr />- Diversity fosters innovation and varied problem-solving approaches.<hr />- Prioritize listening in interviews—focus on candidates' narratives.<hr />- Avoid impulse in hiring; maintain quality standards over urgency.<hr />- Emphasize continuous recruitment from diverse environments.<hr /><hr />**Offering:**<hr />- Act quickly with suitable candidates; clarity is key in offers.<hr />- Preserve relationships with candidates who decline; future opportunities may arise.

21.title: How People Matter Should Work
21.description: A philosophical exploration of authentic employee engagement in software companies, focusing on individual contributions, unconventional hiring practices, knowledge sharing culture, and intrinsic motivation rather than superficial happiness metrics.
21.spr_content: - Central thesis: People are the core of business, emphasized in various articles.<hr />- Common narrative: Importance of HR in nurturing talent and fostering engagement.<hr />- Critique: Excessive focus on "how-tos" detracts from genuine value.<hr />- Authenticity over happiness: Real engagement springs from belief in one’s contributions, not merely superficial happiness.<hr />  <hr />- Individual Contribution: <hr />  - Automatic check-ins reveal pride in work.<hr />  - Acknowledgment is vital; recognize the creators behind products.<hr /><hr />- Unconventional hiring approach:<hr />  - Non-traditional backgrounds encouraged; skill over diploma.<hr />  - Value diverse experiences; focus on mindset aligned with engineering vision.<hr />  <hr />- Knowledge Sharing Culture:<hr />  - Informal, driven by curiosity and desire to assist.<hr />  - Team members intrinsically motivated to share knowledge, fostering collective growth.<hr /><hr />- People-driven culture:<hr />  - Incentives matter less than intrinsic motivation; people stay if they choose to.<hr />  - Create an inspiring environment that values contributions, fairness, and open dialogue.<hr />- Focus on fostering a space where personal and collective purposes align.

22.title: How to conduct delivery reports
22.description: How we conduct insightful delivery reports that ensure transparency, improve team performance, and enhance client relationships
22.spr_content: - Goal: Efficient resource allocation, task assignment, issue resolution.<hr />- Report questions: <hr />  1. Did we help the client achieve their targets?<hr />  2. How did the team perform?<hr />  3. Are there any problems needing resolution?<hr /><hr />### Process Overview:<hr />- **Data Gathering:**<hr />  - **Artifact Collection:** <hr />    - Collect proof of work: demo materials, updated documents, project logs.<hr />    - Identify technical and managerial issues.<hr /><hr />- **Team Performance Evaluation:**<hr />  - Assess account managers' client advocacy.<hr />  - Review tech leads' consultation and delivery management.<hr />  - Evaluate individual team member workload and performance.<hr /><hr />- **Project Priority Assessment:**<hr />  - Rank projects by deal size, opportunity potential, and strategic importance.<hr /><hr />### Report Compilation:<hr />- **Project Sorting by Importance:** Rank projects by priority.<hr />- **Client Happiness & Performance Ratings:** Rate satisfaction and performance on a scale of 1 to 5.<hr />- **Issues & Resolutions Logs:** Document encountered issues and implemented solutions.

23.title: How we do effective planning and reporting
23.description: How we do effective planning and reporting at Dwarves
23.spr_content: - **Borderless Company**: Encourages remote work, emphasizes clear communication.<hr />- **Structured Workflow**: Ensures efficient weekly work allocation for team synchronization and timely task completion.<hr />  <hr />### Weekly Planning & Retro<hr />- **Purpose**: Set priorities, align members, and track progress towards monthly goals.<hr />- **Agenda**: <hr />  - Customizable by teams, includes updates, task prioritization, blockers, lessons learned, and weekly goals.<hr />- **Planning Session**:<hr />  - Combined retrospective and planning to minimize meetings.<hr />  - **Participants**: All team members required.<hr />  - **Timing**: Friday afternoon or Monday morning.<hr />  - **Format**: Conducted via Discord voice channel.<hr />  - **Preparation**: Written weekly plan submission before meetings.<hr /><hr />### Weekly Reporting<hr />- **Objective**: Show progress, celebrate achievements, and address challenges.<hr />- **Preparation**: Written reports submitted before the planning session.<hr />- **Focus**: Quality of tasks, challenges/issues, lessons learned, and team contributions.<hr /><hr />### Daily Check-in<hr />- **Timing**: End of each working day, no later than 6 PM.<hr />- **Format**: Standups or written checks depending on team dynamics; brief and focused.<hr />- **Contents**:<hr />  - Daily plan vs. accomplishment.<hr />  - Obstacles to progress.<hr />  - Support needed from team members.<hr />  - Takeaways and lessons learned.<hr /><hr />### Summary<hr />- **Minimum Requirements** for a working week at Dwarves:<hr />  - **Weekly Planning**: Bullet point written plan & meeting at week start/week end.<hr />  - **Weekly Report**: Bullet point written report highlighting progress, challenges, and lessons.<hr />  - **Daily Check-in**: Written check-in at day's end.

24.title: OGIF - Oh God It's Friday
24.description: I would like to introduce to you our new initiative called **OGIF** ,  Oh God It's Friday. Moving forward, our Friday Showcase will have a broader range of topics to discuss and share.
24.spr_content: - Initiative: **OGIF (Oh God It's Friday)**; broaden Friday Showcase topics.<hr />- Reflect: Achievements of the past week; embrace optimism for the future.<hr />- Core Value: Work-life balance; prioritize responsibilities first.<hr />- Work Culture: Foster hard work and provide growth opportunities.<hr />- Redefine TGIF: Not an escape; pursue passion and interests.<hr />- 70/50 Culture: 70% work duties, 50% personal growth; 30% pursue side projects.<hr />- Goal: Positive societal impact; sustainable income through dedication.<hr />- Achievements: 20+ software shipped; collaboration with 20+ clients.<hr />- Graduates excel beyond Dwarves; continued success in careers.<hr />- Open Discussions: Growth opportunities in tech, social development, finance, career paths.<hr />- Community: Welcoming space for diverse opinions; appreciate accomplishments.<hr />- Motto: "TGIF sometimes, OGIF all the time." <hr />- Cheers!

25.title: Our Policy For Remote Working
25.description: Some useful practices we adopted to keep the remote working system goes smoothly. This policy is written in the context of our current company setup.
25.spr_content: - Remote work policy for a full-remote team. <hr />- Accountability remains high for remote and in-office employees. <hr />- Accommodate time zone differences in scheduling meetings. <hr />- Guidelines and tools facilitate effective remote work; personal initiative is essential.<hr />  <hr />**Adoption Practices:**<hr />- **Plan & Prepare:** Ensure strong Wi-Fi, distraction-free space, privacy for calls, and readiness for a full workday.<hr />- **Proactive Check-ins:** Use tools like Slack for availability and project updates; maintain communication.<hr />  <hr />**Calendar Management:**<hr />- Update calendar with remote work locations and availability.<hr /><hr />**Extended Remote Work:**<hr />- Notify about extended remote work (over 3 days), privileges demand proven effectiveness.<hr />- Manager approval required for non-home remote work.<hr /><hr />**Schedule Communication:**<hr />- Inform team at least 3 days in advance about remote work plans:<hr />  - Post notifications in #office.<hr />  - Verbally notify close colleagues.<hr />  - Update calendar.<hr /><hr />**Meeting Protocols:**<hr />- Timely meeting starts are mandatory for all participants.<hr />- Scheduled meetings should be within regular hours (10:30am - 1:00pm).<hr />- Video options for remote participants are standard; audio only by exception.<hr /><hr />**Managerial Oversight:**<hr />- Remote work is a privilege; non-compliance can lead to revocation.<hr />- Regular 1:1s focus on remote work challenges and responsibilities; fosters open feedback.

26.title: Setup email template in Gmail
26.description: How to setup template for email in Gmail
26.spr_content: - Enable Gmail Canned Responses:  <hr />    - Login to Gmail.  <hr />    - Navigate to Settings -> Settings -> Advanced tab.  <hr />    - Activate Canned Responses (Templates) to **Enabled**.  <hr /><hr />- Manage Templates:  <hr />    - Save draft as a new template for later use.  <hr />    - Select an existing template for composing an email.  <hr /><hr />- Template Guidelines:  <hr />    - Highlight placeholders in *red* for easy identification by users.

27.title: Borrowing & requesting company assets
27.description: How to borrow company assets like books or devices, or request new ones. Simple steps for getting the gear you need.
27.spr_content: - **Gear Access:** Company assets (books, devices) available for employee use.<hr />- **Borrowing Process:**<hr />  - Use **Basecamp** for tracking.<hr />  - Navigate to **Woodland** project.<hr />  - Create a **borrow request** in "Request" To-Do list.<hr />  - Format for request: **Your name | Type - Name/Id of asset | Borrowing date | Returning date**.<hr />  - Upload asset photo upon pick-up.<hr />  - Assign To-Do to **HR**.<hr />- **Example Request:** Huy Nguyen | Book - Start With Why | 19/04/2021 | 26/04/2021.<hr />- **Extending Borrow Time:** Update **Returning date** in To-Do, notify HR.<hr />- **Returning Process:**<hr />  - **Report Issues:** Comment on problems in Basecamp.<hr />  - **Return Item:** Bring back to office.<hr />  - **Complete To-Do:** Mark as done once returned in good condition.<hr />- **Requesting New Assets:**<hr />  - Procedure mirrors borrowing.<hr />  - Go to **Woodland** project, access "Asset Requests" To-Do list.<hr />  - Create request: **Your name | Item type - Item name/description | Reason for request**.<hr />  - Assign To-Do to **HR**.<hr />- **Example Request:** Huy Nguyen | Book - Start With Why | For further understanding in inspiration.<hr />- **Be Specific:** Include exact name, model, or link. Explain the 'why' and relevance to team.<hr />- **HR Actions:** <hr />  - Review request and budget.<hr />  - Approve and order item if reasonable.<hr />  - Notify upon arrival via Basecamp.<hr />  - Mark To-Do as done once received.<hr />- **Conclusion:** Simple access to tools enhances productivity.

28.title: Email Communication and Use
28.description: We use email as our formal tool for both internal and external communication. Every email is utilized for a specific field, which comes along with different instructions.
28.spr_content: - **Email as primary communication tool**: Formal channel for internal and external interactions.<hr />  <hr />- **<team@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: External communication only.<hr />  - **Audience**: Clients and external contacts.<hr />  - **Content**: Agreements and announcements.<hr /><hr />- **<ops@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Internal communication.<hr />  - **Audience**: Company employees.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Employment matters: terms, salary, reviews, meetings.<hr />    - Client interactions logged via cc.<hr />  <hr />- **<spawn@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Hiring processes.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Test invitations: Pre-Assessment/Assignment.<hr />    - Notifications from CCAT for application assessments.<hr />    - Confirmation/rejection emails for applicants.<hr />    - Job offers.<hr />    - Automated CV collection from job sites.<hr />  <hr />- **<accounting@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Financial transactions.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Invoices: incoming and outgoing.<hr />    - Salary adjustment notifications via cc from Operations.<hr />    - Tax-related matters.<hr /><hr />- **<thug@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Infrastructure registration. <hr />  - **Content**: Services like Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS.

29.title: Submit a leave request
29.description: A consistent on leave process prevents a company from being accidentally disrupted when an employee request to be absent.
29.spr_content: - Clear leave request process ensures smooth operations and minimal disruption.<hr />- Discuss leave plans with client and team to align tasks.<hr />- Leave request submission steps include:<hr />  - Log into Basecamp.<hr />  - Create ticket in Woodland channel > On-Leave Request list.<hr />  - Format: Name | Type of absence (off/remote) | Date | Shift.<hr />  - Assign to: Project Manager, Account Manager, Project Lead.<hr />- Request timing based on urgency:<hr />  - Urgent: Immediate submission.<hr />  - Non-urgent: 2x absence duration prior.<hr />  - Holiday: 1-2 weeks in advance.<hr />- Example: 8 days advance notice required for leave from Jul 9th-12th.<hr />- Verification involves discussion of workload and resources to prevent project interruptions.<hr />- Approval process includes marking ticket as done, notifying all involved, and updating Google Calendar.<hr />- Client must be informed via email of approved leave, as Basecamp notifications are not sent to them.<hr />- Denial reason documented in the ticket by manager or lead.<hr />- Notify team and client about leave once approved.<hr />- Operations announces holiday period to clients 1-2 weeks in advance.<hr />- Project Manager or Leader sends reminder 2-3 days before holiday.<hr />- Non-urgent responses to clients are prohibited on days off or holidays.

30.title: Understanding your NDA & other agreements
30.description: A guide to the Non-Disclosure, Non-Solicitation, and IP agreements you signed when joining Dwarves.
30.spr_content: - Agreements: Trust foundation between employee, Dwarves, and clients.<hr />- Confidentiality: Essential for protecting business edge and reputation.<hr />  <hr />### Core Promises<hr />1. **Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)**: <hr />   - Keep client, business, and process information confidential.<hr />   - Obligation persists post-employment.<hr />   <hr />2. **Non-Solicitation**:<hr />   - No recruiting Dwarves staff or soliciting clients for 12 months after departure.<hr /><hr />3. **Intellectual Property (IP)**:<hr />   - Anything created at Dwarves belongs to Dwarves.<hr />   - No personal use of company IP after leaving.<hr /><hr />### Day-to-Day Responsibilities<hr />- **During Employment**:<hr />   - Safeguard sensitive information: secure files, avoid inappropriate sharing, use data legitimately.<hr />   - Clarify sharing uncertainties by asking first.<hr /><hr />- **Post-Employment**:<hr />   - Return all company materials and adhere to NDA and non-solicitation commitments.<hr />   - Prohibited from using or sharing confidential info in future roles.<hr /><hr />### Importance of Compliance<hr />- Violations can lead to:<hr />  - Legal action and financial claims.<hr />  - Court orders restricting activities.<hr />  - Damage to professional reputation.<hr /><hr />### Clarification Steps<hr />- Review signed agreements.<hr />- Discuss with a manager for context.<hr />- Contact HR for questions or clarifications.<hr /><hr />- Employee responsibility: Honor agreements to protect Dwarves’ integrity and future. Trust nurtured through care and integrity in work.

31.title: What we value
31.description: Our core values guide our strategies and individual actions so that we create a company whose character is as radical as our work.
31.spr_content: - **Core Values**: Guide decisions, shape culture, define identity at Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- **Craftsmanship**: Pursue excellence; pride in well-crafted software.<hr />- **Teamwork**: Trust and collaboration are essential; rely on each other.<hr />- **Sustainability**: Long-term vision; value balance and health in work.<hr />- **Culture**: Emerges from hires, celebrations, and encouragement; dynamic and evolves.<hr />- **Hiring Philosophy**: Reject toxicity; prioritize team dynamics over potential talent.<hr />- **Self-Management**: Individuals center efforts on collective contribution.<hr />- **Team First**: Coordination over individual heroics; support and listen to each other.<hr />- **Collective Ideology**: Focus on excellence in software engineering and innovation.<hr />- **Like-Minded Individuals**: Seek shared vision and optimism for future.<hr />- **Valuing Uniqueness**: Hire for unique qualities beyond standard evaluations.<hr />- **Emotional Intelligence**: Success hinges on understanding communication and client needs.<hr />- **Actions Over Words**: Value practical contributions over mere discussions.<hr />- **Remote Work**: Encourage flexibility with self-management and accountability.<hr />- **Quality Focus**: Prioritize output quality over hours worked.<hr />- **Automation Mindset**: Automate repetitive tasks; focus on innovation and efficiency.<hr />- **Partnerships Over Transactions**: Build lasting relationships based on mutual growth.<hr />- **Everyone Contributes**: Involve every team member in actionable tasks.<hr />- **Effectiveness Over Busyness**: Value meaningful work over a packed schedule.<hr />- **Engineering Discipline**: Systematic approaches prevent complexity and expense.<hr />- **Lean Thinking**: Eliminate waste; prioritize value in every action.<hr />- **Long-Term Thinking**: Decisions must benefit collective future rather than individual interests.<hr />- **Software's Role**: Integral to modern life; drives transformation across industries.<hr />- **Creating Resilience**: Mindful actions shape sustainable futures; avoid short-term thinking.

32.title: $icy in 2024
32.description: Quick recap about $icy progress and what's next in 2024.
32.spr_content: - $icy has been integrated since 2020, evolving through phases of community engagement.<hr />- 2020: Initiation of ICY as a community experiment.<hr />- 2021: Launch of icy.so for redeeming $icy.<hr />- 2022: $icy established as primary reward, distributing ~$20,000 during summit-2022 and doty.<hr />- 2023: Introduction of `vault` for team rewards. <hr />- Upcoming developments: <hr />  - Salary advance for full-time personnel.<hr />  - Discord utility commands for $icy tasks.<hr />  - Direct withdrawal of $icy to bank accounts.<hr />  - Launch of $icy store.<hr />  - Staking options for $icy.<hr />- Plans in place, coding to commence.<hr />- Call to action for developers seeking bounty rewards, contact @hnh on Discord.
