551.title: Approaches To Manage Concurrent Workloads Like Worker Pools And Pipelines
551.description: Explore efficient techniques for handling concurrent workloads in Go, including worker pools, fan-out/fan-in patterns, pipelines, and semaphores. This guide provides practical examples, code snippets, and insights into implementing these patterns, discussing their benefits and potential drawbacks. Learn how to improve performance, scalability, and resource management in Go applications while avoiding common pitfalls like deadlocks and excessive resource consumption.
551.spr_content: - Go enables high-performance concurrent programming, utilizing multiple cores via GOMAXPROCS.<hr />- Despite easy-to-use concurrency primitives, careful coding is essential to avoid bugs.<hr />- Concurrency patterns in Go, such as the Worker Pool and Fan-out/Fan-in, structure primitive combinations for better task handling.<hr />- The Worker Pool pattern involves:<hr />  - Allocating a fixed number of workers for task processing.<hr />  - Challenges include limited scalability and inability for task prioritization.<hr />  - A dynamic worker pool can adapt worker numbers based on task load.<hr />- Factors for effective worker pool implementation:<hr />  - Resource management using timeouts for prolonged tasks.<hr />  - Use of priority queues for task prioritization.<hr />- The Fan-out/Fan-in pattern:<hr />  - Distributes tasks across workers, increasing throughput.<hr />  - Gathers results into a combined output, improving performance.<hr />- The pipeline pattern:<hr />  - Segments tasks into stages, promoting modular design.<hr />  - Concurrency can enhance performance, but increases complexity and risk of blocking.<hr />- Semaphore pattern:<hr />  - Manages resource access and limits concurrent task execution.<hr />  - Risks include deadlocks, starvation, and performance overhead.<hr />- Performance considerations for goroutines:<hr />  - Context switching can add overhead; manage goroutine count efficiently.<hr />  - High goroutine counts can lead to resource limitations; monitor usage.<hr />  - Use channels for communication and avoid shared memory to prevent race conditions.<hr />- Keep critical sections brief to minimize conflict and optimize synchronization.

552.file_path: playground/Frontend/A Fragment Colocation Pattern with React & Apollo GraphQL.md
552.title: A Fragment Colocation Pattern with React & Apollo GraphQL
552.description: When working with complex GraphQL schemas, it's common to have shared fields across different types. A fragment colocation pattern allows us to define fragments alongside their corresponding components, resulting in a more cohesive and maintainable codebase.
552.spr_content: - **Shared Fields in GraphQL**: Common fields across different types in complex GraphQL schemas.<hr />- **Fragment Colocation Pattern**: Define GraphQL fragments alongside components for maintainability and cohesion.<hr />- **Benefits of Colocation**:<hr />  - **Code Reusability**: Reuse fragments in various components, reducing redundant code.<hr />  - **Consistency**: Ensures uniform fragment definitions across components.<hr />  - **Readability**: Fragments defined with components enhance understanding of used fields.<hr />  - **Prevents Overfetching**: Fragments enable fetching only required data, aligning with GraphQL principles.<hr />  - **Automatic Typing**: TypeScript interfaces generated from fragments ensure type accuracy.<hr /><hr />- **Tools to Enhance Workflow**:<hr />  - **React**: Framework for building user interfaces.<hr />  - **Apollo GraphQL**: Manages local and remote data with GraphQL; handles UI updates through caching.<hr />  - **@graphql-codegen/cli**: Automates generation of typed queries, mutations, and resolvers from GraphQL schema.<hr /><hr />- **Understanding Fragments**: <hr />  - A fragment is reusable logic shared across queries. It encapsulates a subset of fields from its associated type.<hr />  - Example: Fragment `NameParts` captures fields `firstName` and `lastName` from `Person`.<hr /><hr />- **Implementation Example**:<hr />  - Use fragments for shared fields in `AnimalModel` for `Cat` and `Dog` components.<hr />  - GraphQL fragments for `AnimalFragment`, `CatFragment`, and `DogFragment` help in structuring data.<hr />  - Generate TypeScript types using `@graphql-codegen/cli`.<hr /><hr />- **Component Creation**:<hr />  - Define `CatCard` and `DogCard` components with props typed from their corresponding fragments.<hr />  - Implement `CatList` and `DogList` to handle data fetching with hooks generated by codegen.<hr /><hr />- **Advantages**:<hr />  - Promotes modularity, reducing complexity in managing field definitions.<hr />  - Facilitates easier updates across multiple uses of the same fragments.<hr /><hr />- **Disadvantages**:<hr />  - Risk of fragment duplication if not organized properly.<hr />  - Complexity in managing, especially in larger applications.<hr />  - Learning curve for those used to RESTful approaches.<hr /><hr />- **Conclusion**: <hr />  - Fragment colocation enhances maintainability, promoting structured, optimized code.<hr />  - Encourages adoption with potential pitfalls in complexity and organization, deemed valuable despite challenges.<hr />- **Personal Insight**: Adopting the pattern is straightforward; mastering it requires diligence to avoid pitfalls.

553.title: Forward Engineering September 2024
553.description: In Q3/2024 Forward Engineering, we explore new tech stacks, engineering excellence, and key trends from the tech market over the past three months, with a focus on AI. Learn about tools like Dify, LangGraph, RAG, and more as we share our experiments and insights. Whether you’re interested in AI-driven workflows or tech market trends like the surge in AI startups and hiring demand.
553.spr_content: - **Dwarves' Mission**: Passionate about technology. Focus on creation, study, testing, documentation, and open source. Aim to enhance technology for all.<hr />- **Forward Engineering Issue**: Explore new tech stacks, engineering excellence, key market insights over three months, AI as a central theme.<hr />  <hr />### Tech Innovations:<hr />- **Dify (Adopt)**: Open-source platform simplifying LLM application development. Intuitive due to drag-and-drop interface, facilitating rapid prototyping and workflow orchestration.<hr />- **LangGraph (Assess)**: Library for stateful, multi-actor applications using LLMs. Enhances agent workflows with graph structure, needs further exploration.<hr />- **Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) (Adopt)**: Allows AI to access external data, improving contextual understanding and performance of LLM applications.<hr />- **LangSmith (Trial)**: Builds on LangChain, focusing on production reliability and maintainability. Introduces tracing for debugging and automated testing.<hr />- **Cursor (Assess)**: AI-enhanced IDE built on VS Code, improving coding efficiency through contextual code generation.<hr />- **Devbox (Trial)**: Tool for creating reproducible development environments without complex setups, enhances productivity but requires familiarity with Nix.<hr />- **Shadcn/ui (Trial)**: Modular, customizable UI components speeding up development. Concerns about consistency resolved with Tailwind configuration.<hr /><hr />### Insights & Research Highlights:<hr />- **Structured Outputs**: Critical in LLM APIs, likely to become standard.<hr />- **RAG Re-ranking**: Improves relevance of retrieved contexts.<hr />- **Feedback Mechanism**: Essential for app performance evaluation and improvement.<hr />- **Multi-agent Collaboration**: Distributes workloads effectively for task completion.<hr />- **Thought Prompting**: AI enhances prompt crafting for LLMs.<hr /><hr />### Market Trends:<hr />- **Tech Layoffs**: Surge signals ongoing instability in tech jobs, potentially long-term restructuring.<hr />- **2024 Tech Landscape**: Shift towards stable technologies, increased competition for roles, rise of AI tools in coding and documentation.<hr />- **AI Integration**: Substantial impact on coding practices, leading to potential new business models and workforce shifts towards AI roles.<hr />- **AI Startups**: 72% of recent Y Combinator batch focused on AI, indicating a transformative impact on the startup ecosystem.<hr /><hr />### Conclusion:<hr />AI is reshaping technology and development workflows. Organizations must adapt to the evolving landscape or risk obsolescence. Emphasis on collaboration, rapid innovation, and ethical considerations in AI will dictate future market dynamics.

560.title: Dwarves Tech Radar
560.description: We launch The Dwarves Tech Radar as a living asset to evaluate the adoption decision and keep the technology direction stays on track. Tech Radar is how we do R&D, how we work on self-growth and motivate continuous curiosity.
560.spr_content: - Technology is rapidly evolving; yesterday's tools may become obsolete.<hr />- New technologies generate innovative solutions for existing problems.<hr />- Company culture emphasizes engineering principles and a tech-savvy workforce.<hr />- Mission: Empower innovation and co-create the future.<hr />- Continuous learning of cutting-edge technologies enhances quality and expedites development.<hr />- The Dwarves Tech Radar functions as a living asset for evaluating technology adoption and guiding R&D.<hr />- The radar promotes self-growth and encourages curiosity among team members.<hr /><hr />**Adoption Process:**<hr />- Evaluate new technology against market movements and long-term benefits.<hr />- Goal: Determine if new tech enhances processes aligned with development direction.<hr />- Encourage the formation of focus groups for in-depth discussions.<hr /><hr />**Quadrants of Tech Radar:**<hr />1. Languages and Frameworks (e.g., Erlang, Svelte)<hr />2. Techniques (e.g., design techniques, microservices architecture)<hr />3. Tools (e.g., editors, databases)<hr />4. Platforms (e.g., Vault, Istio)<hr /><hr />**Rings of Tech Radar:**<hr />- Adopt: Proven and mature technologies.<hr />- Trial: Ready for use but not fully validated.<hr />- Assess: Technologies to evaluate further.<hr />- Hold: Technologies that do not fit or have previously yielded poor experiences.<hr /><hr />- Organized updates and discussions tracked in a GitHub repository (dwarvesf/radar).<hr />  <hr />**Tech Knowledge Areas:**<hr />- Essential knowledge areas for software engineers:<hr />  1. Requirement analysis<hr />  2. Design<hr />  3. Development<hr />  4. Testing<hr />  5. Deployment<hr />  6. Maintenance/Monitoring<hr />- Knowledge areas evolve; foundational topics are critical for engineers’ skillsets.

561.title: Forward Engineering 2022
561.description: We want to demonstrate and encourage individual and organizational learning, where both gaining and sharing knowledge is prioritized, valued, and rewarded. Learning is an ongoing process that never ends in our fast-moving industry.
561.spr_content: - **Learning Culture**: Dwarves Foundation prioritizes individual and organizational learning.  <hr />- **Growth Mindset**: Emphasis on the belief in ability to grow through experience.  <hr />- **Open Environment**: Encouragement for asking questions and admitting knowledge gaps.  <hr />- **Opportunities for Growth**: Support for professional development through conferences and interdepartmental projects.  <hr />- **Peer Teaching**: Every employee is seen as a potential teacher, fostering knowledge sharing.  <hr />- **Commitment to Tools and Training**: Providing resources for employee success.  <hr />- **Learning Initiatives**: <hr />  - **Monday's Radio Talk**: Weekly discussions on various topics.  <hr />  - **Friday's Showcase**: Presenting ongoing work within the company.  <hr />  - **Brainery**: Compilation of educational materials aimed at public learning improvement.  <hr />  - **R&D Topics**: Hub for problem-solving and continuous learning.  <hr />  - **Dwarves Rewind**: Weekly insights and industry reviews.  <hr /><hr />- **Brainery Evolution**: Reorganized since August 2021, significant growth anticipated.  <hr />- **Trending Tags**: Reflects diverse contributions in frontend, backend, and data.  <hr />- **Newest Contributors**: Public acknowledgment of first-time knowledge contributors.  <hr />- **Research and Development Focus**: Addressing common software challenges collectively.  <hr />- **Challenges Identified**: Localization, database management, and concurrency issues.  <hr />- **Completed Challenge**: Implementation of feature flags; enhances development efficiency.  <hr />- **Upcoming Challenges**: Topics include cryptocurrency systems, layer 2 designs, on-chain indexing.  <hr />- **Research Narratives**: Software Design research group explores database strategies and patterns.  <hr />- **Dwarves Rewind Recap**: Aggregated weekly tech news and major industry changes.  <hr />- **Trending Topics Insight**: Current discussions on blockchain technology and AI advancements.  <hr />- **Thought Exploration**: Weekly reflections on industry questions and technological implications.

562.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 02
562.description: Dwarves Tech Radar v2 contains the practices to simplify the workflow, new techniques/ approach methods to upgrade our current standards and expand the domain knowledge.
562.spr_content: - Monthly Radar updates assess and adopt innovative technologies.<hr />- Aim: Simplify workflow, upgrade standards, expand domain knowledge.<hr />  <hr />## Trial Technologies<hr />1. **Earthly**: Combines Dockerfile and Makefile for streamlined CI/CD.<hr />   - Simplifies debugging between local and CI environments.<hr />   - Merges multiple tools into one framework, reducing integration burden.<hr />   - Facilitates local CI testing, enhancing development efficiency.<hr />   - Accelerates pipeline execution via parallel target execution.<hr />   <hr />2. **Webflow**: No-code platform for visual web development.<hr />   - Bridges gap between designers and developers.<hr />   - Enables design-to-production workflow without coding.<hr />   - Advantages: Collaborative sharing, easy export of codebases (HTML/CSS/JSON).<hr />   - Limitations: Complex animations and responsiveness issues need improvement.<hr />  <hr />3. **Volta**: Tool manager for JavaScript project versioning.<hr />   - Automates Node version management to reduce manual errors.<hr />   - Unified node versions within project dependencies for seamless transitions.<hr />   - Simplifies npm package binary installations across projects.<hr /><hr />## Adopted Technology<hr />1. **Upptime**: Simplified real-time status monitoring.<hr />   - Requires only a GitHub repository and configuration file for setup.<hr />   - Easier than previous CState integration, suitable for bootstrapping.<hr />   - Customized implementation at [stt.daf.ug](http://stt.daf.ug/).

563.title: Forward Engineering October 2023
563.description: As we step into the exciting opportunities of October, we are at a crucial point in the ever-changing world of technology. Our adventure until now has been for the most part very exciting, with a strong focus on 'Full-stack engineering’ Now, we shift our attention to a topic that is prolific and always true: Open-source.
563.spr_content: - October brings opportunities in the tech landscape, emphasizing **Open-source** as a cornerstone for projects, learning, startups, and enterprises.<hr />- Open-source fosters the freedom to use, modify, and share software, contributing to bug fixes and advancing tech and AI.<hr />- The **Dwarves Foundation Tech Radar Report** highlights technologies vital to engineering growth, focusing on methodologies and tools enhancing efficiency.<hr />- **Type-safe Server Client Development**: Trial of automated OpenAPI Spec generation improves data type consistency between client and server.<hr />- Implemented **Next.js boilerplate** for backend and frontend, integrating type safety into developer training programs.<hr />- Transitioning internal tool **Fortress** to a type-safe framework to enhance reliability.<hr />- **AI-aided development**: Exploring AI tools for code writing; Frontend Development Course showcases promising projects from community and engineers.<hr />- Developed **Code reviewer** and **Resume AI** tools during Frontend training courses.<hr />- **DuckDB**: An embedded database management system ideal for analytical workloads under 10GB, streamlining operations without needing a data warehouse.<hr />- **Devcontainers**: Visual Studio Code feature allows for containerized, full-featured development environments, enhancing developer onboarding and experience.<hr />- R&D expanding on emerging trends in development productivity, UI design, and engineering paradigms.<hr />- Researching **Elixir**, **Rust**, **WASM**, **Aspect-Oriented Programming**, and **Passwordless authentication**.<hr />- Introducing **Google Analytics 4**: Expanding analytics capabilities beyond defaults; modeling and cleaning event data.<hr />- **IFramely**: A library for managing URL embeds consistently, focusing on user experience and content integration.<hr />- **Dwarves Rewind**: Curated reading list of trending tech news for industry insights.<hr />- Trending topics: Next.js version 14's careful updates; X's release of **Grok**, a competitive large language model attracting significant industry interest.

564.title: Forward Engineering November 2023
564.description: We have focused on revamping how we learn, familiarize, and work with tech. We are excited to announce that we have updated our Forward Engineering to better reflect the feedback and insights from our Labs team, Operations Team, and Consulting Team.
564.spr_content: - **Focus on Learning and Collaboration**: Revamping tech understanding, enhancing Forward Engineering publication.<hr />- **Community Feedback Integration**: Insights from Labs, Operations, Consulting Teams to improve clarity and information sharing.<hr />- **Technology Update Goals**: Informing on latest tech, promoting innovation and collaboration within the organization. <hr />- **Feedback Encouragement**: Welcoming responses on the publication content for continuous improvement.<hr /><hr />### **Tech Radar Highlights**:<hr />- **Rust**: <hr />  - Tags: `#memory-management`, `#systems-language`, `#backend`<hr />  - Evolving capabilities in web development, AI.<hr />  - Initial focus on concurrency model for community project.<hr />  <hr />- **Building UI Library Practices**:<hr />  - Tags: `#ui`, `#ux`, `#frontend`<hr />  - Transition to open-source UI library for internal applications.<hr />  - Challenges: documentation, release workflows, modular design.<hr /><hr />- **DuckDB**:<hr />  - Tags: `#data`, `#data-analysis`, `#database`<hr />  - In-process database management system for analytics.<hr />  - High performance with SQL capabilities, optimized for complex queries.<hr /><hr />- **Parallel Processing**:<hr />  - Tags: `#data-science`, `#parallel-execution`<hr />  - Enables simultaneous task execution across CPUs.<hr />  - Demonstrated benefits through DuckDB in data processing.<hr /><hr />### **Labs Roadmap**:<hr />- **Key Topics for Development**: Identified by Labs and Consulting teams.<hr />- **WebAssembly Focus**: Near-native execution capabilities for multi-language code on web.<hr />- **Upcoming Research Areas**:<hr />  - **WASM**: Performance optimization, memory management.<hr />  - **Passwordless Authentication**: Biometrics, QR code login, Magic Links.<hr />  - **Artificial Intelligence**: Real-time updates, privacy concerns.<hr />  - **Multi-Party Computation**: Authentication in web3 contexts.<hr />  - **UI Library Best Practices**: Consistency, usability, accessibility.<hr /><hr />### **Dwarves Rewind - Discord Insights**:<hr />- Interests in WASM and performance optimization.<hr />- Technologies discussed:<hr />  - **Ziglang**: Simplicity and performance in systems programming.<hr />  - **Panda CSS**: Utility library for responsive UI design.<hr />  - **Plop.js**: Code generation for workflow consistency.<hr />  - **WebAssembly**: Efficient execution of various language codes in browsers.<hr />  - **Langchain**: Framework for LLM applications simplification.<hr />  - **GPT-4 Vision**: Multimodal capabilities for image and text interaction.<hr />  - **Rust**: Safety and concurrency in programming. <hr /><hr />Overall, the publication emphasizes the commitment to tech innovation, community involvement, and practical application challenges across various domains.

565.title: Forward Engineering May 2023
565.description: As we look back on the past month, we're excited to share our latest engineering report, which highlights our recent achievements, projects, and insights in May 2023.
565.spr_content: - Technological landscape: vast, opportunities for exploration and growth.<hr />- May report: reflection on journey, charting future course.<hr />- Strategic focus: Exploring Large Language Models (LLMs); enhance user interactions and business understanding.<hr />- Automation framework: implemented using Codecept and Playwright; streamline tasks, refine workflows.<hr />- Assessing Radix UI: developing intuitive, accessible user interfaces.<hr />- Primary focus: LLM exploration; commitment to learning, value delivery, and innovative agility.<hr />  <hr />## Large Language Models<hr />- Potential of GPT-3/GPT-4/ChatGPT, Poe, Claude acknowledged.<hr />- Aim for accurate outputs; model fine-tuning hindered by costs.<hr />- Focus on foundation models due to infrastructure expenses and data quality concerns.<hr />- Opportunity to develop applications leveraging LLM power; expanding expertise remains a priority.<hr /><hr />## LangChain<hr />- Exploring LangChain for building LLM-driven applications.<hr />- Features: prompt management, data augmentation, action sequencing, enhances utilization of LLMs.<hr />- Observed benefits for customer service, content generation, data analysis.<hr />- Current integration in smaller projects to assess capabilities.<hr /><hr />## Prompt Engineering<hr />- Enhances outputs of LLMs via meticulous prompt crafting.<hr />- Improves chatbots’ effectiveness, customizes AI behavior.<hr />- Strategy: educate teams, support learning, gradually integrate into systems.<hr /><hr />## Codecept<hr />- Powerful framework for end-to-end testing; automates processes.<hr />- Advantages: simplicity, multi-tasking, framework support, modular structure.<hr />- Conducting various tests, including functional and API testing; comprehensive reporting aids debugging.<hr /><hr />## Radix UI<hr />- Adopted modular, customizable component library for UI development.<hr />- Integrates well with TailwindCSS; enhances accessibility and styling.<hr />- Efficient, flexible UI construction; a solution for previous challenges with HeadlessUI.<hr /><hr />## Brainery Growth<hr />- Focus on Meaning, Mastery, and Autonomy (MMA) for team culture.<hr />- Shift in contributions: concise writing, clearer concepts.<hr /><hr />## Trending Tags<hr />- Increased focus on LLM and AI, alongside backend/frontend foundational topics (web design, OOP, SOLID).<hr /><hr />## Research & Development Challenges<hr />- Addressing common challenges: innovating payment systems, optimizing vector databases for recommender systems.<hr />- Completed challenge: Distributed Concurrency over a single database.<hr />- Future focus on access control management, design payment systems, and AI augmentation.<hr /><hr />## Software Design Research Group<hr />- Addressing SMEs' concerns: security, access control, database mechanisms.<hr />- Investigating: explicit locking in SQL DBMS, role-based access control (RBAC), load balancer functions.<hr /><hr />## Dwarves Rewind May 2023<hr />- Curated reading list of trending tech topics.<hr />- Notable trends: AI advancements (GPT-4), free prompt engineering course, VS Code Day, generative agents research.<hr /><hr />## Thoughts List<hr />- Technology maturity and stability critical for frontend stack selection.<hr />- AI-powered applications becoming accessible; context-dependent model outputs.<hr />- Node.js evolution noted; community's rapid adaptation cited.<hr />- Anticipation of LLMs' adaptive prompting capabilities surpassing current input skill levels.

566.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 03
566.description: In short, this 3rd volume is all about one thing: Trial
566.spr_content: 1. Dwarves Foundation Tech Radar - Volume 3 focuses on **Trial**.<hr />2. Previous volumes assessed tech indexes (Volume 1), simplified workflows (Volume 2).<hr />3. Highlights testing tools, development frameworks, DevOps, and no-code platforms.<hr />4. **k6**: Open-source load testing tool; verifies system tolerance using JS scripts, integrates with developer tools.<hr />5. **Testlink**: Open-source test management tool; manages tests, cases, and reports; integration with automation tools like Jira.<hr />6. **Preact**: Lightweight React alternative (3kb); same API; enhances app loading speed, used for marketplace projects.<hr />7. **ArgoCD**: Kubernetes controller; monitors application states, manages code versions on K8s.<hr />8. **Webflow**: No-code development tool; successfully applied in previous projects (KiwiPay, ATVPro); user-friendly interface.<hr />9. **Bubble.io**: More complex no-code tool; issues with code adjustment and learning curve for designers, leading to a pause in use.<hr />10. GitHub repositories available for all volumes: [r/dwarvesf/radar](https://github.com/dwarvesf/radar).

567.title: Tool-Level Security for Remote MCP Servers
567.description: A comprehensive guide to implementing granular access control for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers, allowing organizations to securely expose tool capabilities based on user roles and permissions while maintaining data privacy.
567.spr_content: - Model Context Protocol (MCP): Standardized framework for AI-to-tool communication.<hr />- Role-Based Access Control (RBAC): Enhances security by associating tools with defined permissions.<hr />- Access control necessity: Protect sensitive data, ensure authorized tool usage, comply with regulations (GDPR, HIPAA, CCPA).<hr />- Multi-layered security: Prevent unauthorized actions beyond intended privileges.<hr />- Tool-level access control: Enforces permissions during tool invocation, combining role definitions with permissions.<hr />- Tool registry: Central configuration mapping tools to permissions and data access policies.<hr />- Users, roles, permissions structure: Tables establishing relationships for access control; permissions assigned to roles, mapped to users.<hr />- Resource access rules: Fine-grained access to specific data elements, supporting row/field-level security.<hr />- Permission enforcement: Operational checks during tool listing and execution phases to prevent unauthorized access.<hr />- Data access policies: Specify user access levels to particular data within tools to ensure confidentiality.<hr />- Integration with identity systems: Uses existing user identities while managing MCP-specific permissions.<hr />- Audit trails: Captures security events and access attempts for monitoring and compliance.<hr />- Security considerations: Defense in depth, least privilege principle, regular reviews, data minimization, and field-level security.<hr />- Wrap-up: Establishes secure foundations for AI capabilities, facilitating robust tool and data access while maintaining compliance and security.

568.title: Create slides with Overleaf and ChatGPT
568.description: This article shares a workflow for making slide decks with Overleaf and ChatGPT. It solves issues like slow content creation using ChatGPT and formats with Overleaf’s themes. It includes examples, tips, and a Dify automation for engineers.
568.spr_content: - **Presentation Needs**: Shift from casual tools to professional platforms for serious meetings.<hr />- **Overleaf Advantage**: Ensures consistent, polished slide design with minimal effort; built-in themes streamline presentation quality.<hr />- **Markdown Limitations**: Faster writing, but struggle with visual refinement; lacks professionalism.<hr />- **Collaboration Features**: Overleaf supports online teamwork; no version confusion.<hr />- **AI Integration**: Use ChatGPT for content creation, simplifying idea generation while Overleaf formats slides.<hr />- **Two-Step Method**: 1) Generate content with ChatGPT’s structured prompts. 2) Format with Overleaf’s predefined themes.<hr />- **Efficiency Gains**: ChatGPT reduces writing time; Overleaf provides aesthetic quality without heavy formatting.<hr />- **Example Use Case**: Successfully formatted a talk on data snapshot patterns; saved time while enhancing clarity.<hr />- **Automated Workflow**: Dify tool automates entire process, optimizing content into usable slide format.<hr />- **Practical Tips**: Be specific in ChatGPT prompts; explore Overleaf themes; retain raw text for reference.<hr />- **User-Friendly Steps**: Flow from prompt to slide format; adaptable for any topic.<hr />- **Reflection Opportunity**: Simplified process transforms slide-making; encourages trying out method for future presentations.<hr />- **Potential Benefits**: Reduces stress, increases presentation efficiency; practical for varied fields.

569.title: DuckDB demo and showcase
569.description:
DuckDB is a great starting point for modern stacks that don't need to worry about scalability, but want to derive hard analytics from the data that they have. This meeting will do a 3-part demo of DuckDB (15 minutes total):
• Consolidate NYC taxi data in parallel (through map-reduce) over HTTPS
• Aggregate IBM AML transactions (Anti-Money Laundering)
• Some examples of how it is used to consolidate and do basic analytics on note.d and log.console.so
569.spr_content: - Event: DuckDB demo and showcase, Online.<hr />- Date: November 30, 2023, from 09:00 to 10:30 UTC. <hr />- Type: Internal presentation in Discord channel 🗣️・labs-stage. <hr />- Focus: DuckDB as an emerging OLAP database for analytics with 1GB-10GB data ranges.<hr />- Context: Analyzing small data chunks fuels startups like MotherDuck.<hr />- Demo Agenda: <hr />  1. Consolidate NYC taxi data in parallel (map-reduce over HTTPS).<hr />  2. Aggregate IBM Anti-Money Laundering transactions.<hr />  3. Basic analytics examples on note.d and log.console.so.<hr />- Objectives: <hr />  - Evaluate the applicability of DuckDB for current and future projects.<hr />  - Establish a demo format for new technologies.<hr />- Visual Aids: <hr />  - First demo: Aggregation of metadata from Notion into parquet format via memo.d.foundation.<hr />  - Second demo: Using DuckDB for parallel analysis of NYC taxi data, showcasing local tool flexibility vs. server database. <hr />- Implications: Highlight use-cases, benefits, and costs of DuckDB for analytics tasks.
569.tags: demo discussion duckdb dwarves event internal labs work workshop

570.title: How to push content on memo.d.foundation
570.description: This is a guide on how to setup your environment and settings to push content to our notes website, memo.d.foundation.
570.spr_content: - Ensure environment setup is complete as per [guide](https://memo.d.foundation/playground/01_literature/how-to-set-up-environment-for-editing-memo/).<hr />- Confirm access rights for the memo.d.foundation repository.<hr />- Sync local files via Source Control before editing or creating posts.<hr />- Choose a folder for the new post; default: `vault/playground/00_fleeting`.<hr />- Create a new file with a `.md` suffix for Markdown format.<hr />- Insert metadata structure at the post's beginning:<hr />  ```md<hr />  ---<hr />  tags:<hr />    - [tag1]<hr />    - [tag2]<hr />    - [tag3]<hr />  title: [The title]<hr />  date: yyyy-mm-dd<hr />  description: [your description]<hr />  authors: [your name]<hr />  ---<hr />  ```<hr />- Edit content below the metadata section.<hr />- Save changes with `Cmd+S`.<hr />- Preview changes by opening devbox with `devbox shell`, then run `make watch-run` to access localhost.<hr />- Capture full page of the post using Cleanshot's Scrolling Capture and send to supervisor and @anna for review.<hr />- To commit changes:<hr />  1. Access Source Control section.<hr />  2. Sync changes in the memo.d.foundation and edit branch.<hr />  3. Stage changes in the edited branch.<hr />  4. Name the commit and execute the Commit action.<hr />- Create a Pull Request on GitHub:<hr />  1. Log in and access Your repositories.<hr />  2. Select the edited branch.<hr />  3. Open pull request list.<hr />  4. Select the commit and create the pull request.<hr />- Await admin review of the request.

571.title: Tech Canvas
571.description: This is where we share our journey in the ever-evolving landscape of technology. It’s a space where we unveil our latest breakthroughs, discuss our research, and delve into our innovative projects. Just as an artist expresses their vision on a canvas, we use this platform to paint a picture of our technological advancements and how they’re shaping the future.
571.spr_content: - Technology journey: Sharing breakthroughs, research, and projects.<hr />- Canvas analogy: Artistry in technological advancements shaping the future.<hr />- Fieldwork expansion: Tackling nuanced firm problems, from big data to complex business logic.<hr />  - Notification structuring: Timing and batching best practices.<hr />  - Indexing strategies: Enhancing semantic matching of user queries through full-text and vector databases.<hr />  - Subscription logic: Navigating complexity in monthly and annual plans with feature switches.<hr />  <hr />- Laboratory focus: AI and LLM exploration, implementing sophisticated output systems.<hr />  - RAG data pipeline: Unifying data sources to enrich LLM outputs.<hr />  - Infinite memory app: Optimizing conversational memory for LLM knowledge bases.<hr />  - Faster vector DB retrieval: Transforming data for efficiency.<hr />  - Vector indexing pitfalls: Identifying effective and ineffective vector indexes.<hr />  - Content ranking in RAG: Emerging design standards for AI content embedding.<hr />  - Function calling analysis: Foundational look at AI agents and structured data necessity.<hr /><hr />- Lab projects: Product initiatives to investigate researched landscapes.<hr />  - LLM Builder: Comprehensive chatbot integrating documentation and knowledge bases.<hr />  - News Aggregator: Engineered platform for tech news and software insights.<hr /><hr />- Market updates: Continuous trends in AI, FinOps, and CyberSecurity as of Feb-Apr 2024.<hr />  - Software as a Service (SaaS) rebound: Impacting startup cost structures and workflows.<hr />  - Intersection of design and engineering: Emerging trends in AI, API techniques, and programming languages.<hr /><hr />- Community bounties: Shared challenges with product teams:<hr />  - Internal notes migration.<hr />  - Tooling enhancements and utility commands.<hr />  - Ongoing status updates on various bounty projects.

572.title: Memo Publication Workflow
572.description: This guide will help you step-by-step create content and publish on memo.
572.spr_content: - Identify writing field: blockchain, communication, design, engineering, market, security, writing.<hr />- Use `playground` directory for topic-specific content.<hr />- Seek clarification on content placement via Discord support.<hr />- Set up local environment; follow setup guide.<hr />- Article requirements: title, description, author, date, tags.<hr />- File naming convention: kebab case.<hr />- Ensure all links function properly by local repository verification.<hr />- Store images in `assets` folder; reference correctly in articles.<hr />- Follow image guidelines for screenshots; consult dedicated guide.<hr />- Clarify article status: draft or final, to reviewer.<hr />- Content review by experts based on area (e.g., engineering, communications).<hr />- Formatting feedback from designated reviewer.<hr />- Gather and implement feedback; consult publication lifecycle article for details.

573.title: How to set up environment to edit memo
573.description: This is a guide on how to setup your environment and settings to push content to our notes website, memo.d.foundation.
573.spr_content: - SSH key: Secure authentication method (public/private key).<hr />- Public key: Shared with servers (e.g., GitHub); private key: kept secret on local machine.<hr />- SSH connection: Server verifies identity via fingerprint comparison of public key.<hr />- Secure connection established if fingerprints match and correct passphrase provided.<hr />- SSH key generation: Follow [instructions](https://g.co/gemini/share/3972239af940).<hr />- Steps to generate SSH key: <hr />  1. Create SSH key pair (public/private).<hr />  2. Save private key locally.<hr />  3. Submit public key to GitHub.<hr />  <hr />- Install Visual Studio Code: Download from [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/).<hr />  <hr />- Install Devbox:<hr />  1. Open VSCode Terminal (`Control + ~`).<hr />  2. Run command: `curl -fsSL https://get.jetpack.io/devbox | bash`.<hr />  <hr />- Pull GitHub source to local disk: Two methods available.<hr />  <hr />- Method 1: Terminal method.<hr />  1. Run `xcode-select` command.<hr />  2. Install [git-credential-manager](https://github.com/git-ecosystem/git-credential-manager/releases/tag/v2.4.1).<hr />  3. Configure Git with user email and name:<hr />     ```sh<hr />     git config --global user.email "you@example.com"<hr />     git config --global user.name "Your Name"<hr />     ```<hr />  4. Clone repository: <hr />     ```sh<hr />     git clone https://github.com/dwarvesf/memo.d.foundation<hr />     ```<hr /><hr />- Method 2: Link VSCode with GitHub account.<hr />  1. Choose "Clone Repositories" option.<hr />  2. Select "Clone from GitHub".<hr />  3. Search for `https://github.com/dwarvesf/memo.d.foundation` and clone it.<hr /><hr />- Setup environment on laptop:<hr />  1. Navigate to cloned repository `memo.d.foundation`.<hr />  2. Run submodule update commands:<hr />     ```sh<hr />     git submodule update --init --recursive<hr />     git submodule update --recursive --remote<hr />     git submodule foreach --recursive 'git checkout main || git checkout master'<hr />     ```<hr />  3. Create "content" folder within node.d.foundation folder.<hr />  4. Preview changes:<hr />     - Open Devbox: `devbox shell`.<hr />     - Run: `make watch-run` to rebuild the website.<hr />  5. Access localhost link generated by `make watch-run` for previews.<hr />  <hr />- Note: If localhost link errors occur, repeat commands `devbox shell` and `make watch-run`. <hr /><hr />- Upcoming: Discuss how to push content on memo.d.foundation.

574.title: 👾 Open bounties
574.description: The Dwarves bounty program is the means through which both company peeps and the community can contribute to our daily activities. This includes tasks like building internal tools, engaging in new technology research and development, or sharing knowledge session
574.spr_content: - Dwarves bounty program: facilitates contributions from company and community. <hr />- Activities include: internal tools, tech R&D, knowledge sharing.<hr />- Part of the ICY initiative: connects contributors to meaningful projects, rewards valuable work.<hr />- To contribute: open a ticket on Discord, notify mods.<hr />- Bounty categorization: organized by specific naming conventions.<hr />  <hr />### File Naming Format<hr />- Pattern: `XXX-descriptive-name.md`<hr />  - `XXX`: 3-digit category code.<hr />  - `descriptive-name`: kebab-case description of bounty.<hr /><hr />### Category Codes<hr />- `0XX`: Continuous research (e.g., `000-productivity.md`).<hr />- `1XX`: Internal tooling (e.g., `101-discord-bot.md`).<hr />- `5XX`: Project-related (e.g., `501-client-project-contribution.md`).<hr />- `8XX`: Miscellaneous (e.g., `801-community-event.md`). <hr /><hr />### Purpose of Naming System<hr />- Enables quick identification of bounty type and purpose within the ecosystem.

575.title: Engineer Performance Review
575.description: Here's another update from Dwarves for you. Throughout September, we have completed our bi-annual performance review.
575.spr_content: - Team Dwarves' performance reviews prioritize engineer-centric design over typical management approaches.<hr />- Engineers reflect on their growth, team perspectives, and professional ambitions in self-reviews.<hr />- Reviews are conducted by team leads or mentors with direct knowledge of the engineers’ work for specific feedback.<hr />- The process emphasizes a two-way dialogue, fostering comfort and openness.<hr />- Performance review criteria extend beyond technical skills to include leadership, collaboration, and organizational contributions.<hr />- The aim is to equip engineers with the skills for software consulting and development across a 3-5 year tenure.<hr />- Reviews occur bi-annually to facilitate goal attainment; outcomes include new rankings and professional growth plans.<hr />- Career advancement, such as achieving “senior” status, requires technical proficiency and team leadership capabilities.<hr />- The Dwarves maintain a strict quality bar to support high standards and foster future leaders within the organization.

576.title: Dwarves Updates
576.description: Hi, this is Han, the CEO of Dwarves Foundation. This month the Dwarves score 40th client that we have the honor to serve. And for that, we decide to launch the Dwarves Updates.
576.spr_content: - Han, CEO of Dwarves Foundation, announces 40th client milestone. <hr />- Launch of Dwarves Updates initiated to share insights and experiences. <hr />- Company operates like software: usability, usefulness, bug fixes, and organizational design matter. <hr />- Dwarves Updates includes lessons learned, tech adoption, team investment, client success stories. <hr />- Encouragement for readers to engage and be part of Dwarves' journey. <hr /><hr />### HR: Apprenticeship Training<hr />- Transition from Internship Program to Apprenticeship Program to enhance talent acquisition.<hr />- Internship Program drawbacks: long onboarding time, limited project contribution, higher management costs, and premature turnover.<hr />- Apprenticeship Program: a six-month earn-and-learn model for candidates with 1-2 years of experience.<hr />- Promises modern work environment, competitive pay, career guidance, peers, and mentorship.<hr />- Initial launch received fewer applications but better quality candidates with clear career goals.<hr />- Ongoing trials to explore further outcomes and experiences. <hr />- Further details available through provided link.

577.title: The stages of hiring at Dwarves
577.description: In today’s edition, job interviews need a makeover, the 4 stages of hiring at Dwarves, Dwarves apprenticeship 2022, other talking points
577.spr_content: - Achievement: Dwarves ranked top 100 in Financial Times’ Asia-Pacific High-Growth Companies.<hr />- Importance of reflection: Recognizing accomplishments boosts team morale.<hr />- Team appreciation: Value of collaboration with colleagues and partners.<hr />  <hr />### Job Interviews<hr />- Need for rethinking: Current tech interview processes often challenge candidates unnecessarily.<hr />- Candidate perspective: Interviews should empower candidates, not feel like begging for jobs.<hr />- Desired interview dynamics: Casual conversations favor mutual exploration and cultural fit.<hr /><hr />### Hiring Process at Dwarves<hr />- Flexible approach: Adjusting processes based on candidate suitability.<hr />- Focus on capability: Technical skills as key hiring criteria.<hr />- Minimal standard questions: Avoiding commonplace queries to discover true potential.<hr />- Collaborative interviews: Involvement of current engineers in hiring feedback.<hr />- Candidate engagement: Encouragement of questions to evaluate company fit.<hr />- Streamlined process: Total interview duration approximately 1 hour 50 mins.<hr /><hr />### Dwarves Foundation Apprenticeship 2022<hr />- Purpose: Promote career advancement through teaching and training.<hr />- Unique offering: First tech apprenticeship program in Vietnam.<hr />- Program structure: A 6-month paid work-study designed for mid-level engineers.<hr />- Benefits for participants: Practical experience, mentorship, and career path development.<hr />  <hr />### Other Initiatives<hr />- Dwarves Discord growth: 300+ members facilitate tech discussions and knowledge sharing.<hr />- Engaging community activities: Increased participation in discussions like Monday Radio Talks.<hr />- Knowledge initiatives: Brainery and Engage & Earn promote knowledge sharing.<hr />- Dalat Chalet: A unique workspace and social hub for team bonding, moving beyond conventional office spaces.<hr />  <hr />- Closing wish: Hope for ongoing success, recognition, and passion in work.

578.title: The Stage of AI and LLM at Dwarves
578.description: Here's another update from Dwarves for you. We are excited to share the real journey of growth and transformation since AI and LLM have been on our radar for quite a long time.
578.spr_content: - Han & Nikki reporting on knowledge system development for team learning.<hr />- Dwarves Memo showcases increased member participation and article publication.<hr />- Long-term investment in AI/LLM competencies.<hr />  <hr />### Working with AI<hr />- Entire team using AI tools: increases speed and accuracy.<hr />- AI project management optimizes workflows and reduces costs/time by 30%.<hr />- Engineers benefit from AI for code generation, automating tasks, and reducing errors.<hr /><hr />### Continuous Learning & Training<hr />- R&D as a core driver of innovation since 2015.<hr />- Focus on AI/LLM: fast-paced learning and building for AI adoption.<hr />- Key technologies:<hr />  - **Large Language Models (LLM)**: content generation, complex query understanding.<hr />  - **NLP Techniques**: sentiment analysis, summarization.<hr />  - **Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)**: enhances information retrieval.<hr />  - **Embedding Technologies**: improves content recommendations.<hr />  - **AI-Powered Analytics**: predicts trends, analyzes patterns.<hr />- Engaging in computer vision for advanced image recognition and multimodal systems.<hr /><hr />### Knowledge Sharing<hr />- Public sharing of learning through Dwarves Memo:<hr />  - Thought prompting, internal tool development, RAG systems, rapid software development, building AI supervisors, feedback mechanisms.<hr /><hr />### AI-Powered Solutions<hr />- Development of custom AI solutions that improve client outcomes:<hr />  - **FornaxAI**: pitches enhancement tool for startups.<hr />  - **Umbrella**: integrated project management system.<hr />  - **Ascenda**: AI-driven loyalty program.<hr />  - **Plot**: centralized project management for media teams.<hr /><hr />### Future Aspirations<hr />- Unique R&D-focused trajectory among Vietnamese vendors.<hr />- Challenges of pursuing innovation contrasted with rewards of progress and collaboration.<hr />- Invitation for collaboration to innovate and succeed together. <hr /><hr />- Closing message of encouragement from Han & Nikki.

579.title: Project Compliance
579.description: This email is the third month we share about our journey to Software Craftsmanship.
579.spr_content: - Team Dwarves shares monthly updates on Software Craftsmanship journey.<hr />- Focus this month: Project delivery compliance.<hr />- Minimizing risks in software development is essential for client and team welfare.<hr />- Risks lead to costs, delays, and diminished morale.<hr />- August's objective: Enhance resource use and project success rates via audits.<hr />- Unproductive procedures eliminated; early identification of defects prioritized.<hr />- Ensure team clarity on work scope, objectives, and requirements.<hr />- Maintain client project timelines; avoid client hindrances.<hr />- Technical audits: Assess system architecture, database design, object structure, implementation techniques.<hr />- Management audits: Engineers' awareness of software and business goals evaluated.<hr />- No critical technical issues detected; insights from management audit valued.<hr />- Importance of project success criteria reiterated to engineers.<hr />- Business intelligence access enhances product ownership and effort.<hr />- Engineers bridging tech and business challenges show proactive behavior.<hr />- Broader understanding of engineering roles encourages deeper involvement in development.<hr />- Goal: Build and ship software, fostering engineer initiative and growth.<hr />- Conclusion: Continued commitment to development and understanding in software engineering.

580.title: The Stage of Growth at Dwarves
580.description: In this update, we are excited to share the real journey of growth and transformation that our team has embarked upon, as we continue to strive to become a more skilled and knowledgable software team.
580.spr_content: - Team update by Han & Nikki; undergoing significant changes.<hr />- Focus on growth and transformation of the software team.<hr />- Shifting focus: Emphasis on fundamental techniques over trends.<hr />- Decision to invest in research for timeless skills in software development.<hr />- Transition to full-stack engineering; understanding entire development process essential for cost-effective solutions.<hr />- Aim to balance company and community roles (50%-50% model).<hr />- Commitment to community engagement and knowledge sharing.<hr />- Highlights of community efforts:<hr />  - Launch of Golang course; 90 registrations, 30 participants.<hr />  - 43 weekly talks featuring global software engineers.<hr />  - Collaboration in 10 tech events; partnerships in Vietnam.<hr />  - Learning site membership growth.<hr />- Collaboration has reinforced team bonds in a remote work environment.<hr />- Implementation of Community Earn model and collaborative R&D initiatives.<hr />- Partner network strategy over traditional marketing; focus on relationships.<hr />- Benefits for partners: trust, resources, expertise, and commission opportunities.<hr />- Uniform criteria for partnerships; open to technology-impact-focused individuals.<hr />- Journey of exploring new operational methods; aim for unity and expanded outcomes.<hr />- Future aspirations center on remarkable results and lasting relationships.

581.title: Engineering Organizational Structure
581.description: It's Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. We're almost at the end of this year. While we know everyone is busy wrapping up 2021, we hope you're taking care of yourself and staying safe.
581.spr_content: - Year-end approach by Team Dwarves: reflect, self-care, safety.<hr />- Engineering ladder refinement focus for November; key growth initiative.<hr />- High-level structure developed to enable scalable team growth.<hr />- Senior engineers promoted to lead positions; increase in influence and leadership.<hr />- Inter-managerial collaboration boosts communication and alignment for better engineering.<hr />- New 60-day onboarding plan for hires to expedite integration into projects.<hr />- Adaptive engineering structure: current organization may evolve with growth.<hr />- Recruitment initiative: establishing offices across Vietnam to attract talent.<hr />- Offices in HCMC, Hanoi, Danang, and Dalat as hubs for collaboration.<hr />- Open invitation for community and partners to utilize office space.<hr />- Rise in Web 3.0 partnerships: 8 requests in one month, growing interest.<hr />- Screening process for projects maintained during demand spikes.<hr />- Dedicated website for Web 3.0 focus to avoid confusion with other services.<hr />- Community engagement through open Discord channel and public events.<hr />- Weekly training sessions for knowledge sharing.<hr />- Future plans for engagement incentives in Dwarves network.<hr />- Gratitude expressed for community feedback and support.

582.title: The Next Leading Chairs
582.description: We like the idea of labeling teams by what they deliver. Hence, the next chapter of Dwarves will be based on five angles.
582.spr_content: - Dwarves Foundation celebrated 5-year milestone in Jan 2020.<hr />- Emphasis on remote culture, prioritizing knowledge and people.<hr />- Key elements: <hr />  - Handbook showcasing culture and vision.<hr />  - ESOP for equitable reward sharing.<hr />  - Automation to enhance focus on core strengths; current resource ratio 70 engineers to 10 operations.<hr />- Celebrating Dwarves 2.5 with 80 team members.<hr />- 3 remote offices: Saigon, Danang, Dalat.<hr />- Growth achieved: 46% increase in team scale.<hr />- Diversification as a key to progress.<hr />- New structure introduces roles focusing on:<hr />  - Partnership (Nikki Ngoc Truong): Impactful tech collaborations.<hr />  - Delivery (Duc Thanh Pham, Ngoc Thanh Pham, Huy Tieu): Quality production outputs.<hr />  - Learning (Tom Nguyen, Hieu Vu): Continuous learning initiatives.<hr />  - Communication (Nikki Ngoc Truong): Transparency in information sharing.<hr />  - Engagement (Huy Nguyen, Giang Than): Unified vision across teams.<hr />- Acknowledgment of team's evolution and commitment to future growth.

583.title: Build your knowledge base
583.description: In an age where Large Language Models like ChatGPT offer instant access to a universe of information, it raises the question, does our own personal knowledge base still hold any value, and is building a personal knowledge base still a legitimate thing to do?
583.spr_content: - Large Language Models (LLMs) provide instant information access.<hr />- Personal knowledge bases retain value in the age of AI.<hr />- Curating knowledge is essential; akin to creating a personalized mixtape.<hr />- Personal knowledge is uniquely tailored, unlike generic AI outputs.<hr />- Efficient access to relevant information, avoiding irrelevant data.<hr />- Building a knowledge base promotes mastery over mere information consumption.<hr />- Innovation arises from connecting unique insights within personal knowledge.<hr />- Authenticity differentiates human contributions from AI-generated content.<hr />- Personal knowledge bases reflect individual identity and perspective.<hr />- In an information-saturated world, ownership and personalization of knowledge is crucial.<hr />- Maintaining a personal knowledge base fosters growth and success in an AI-driven era.

584.title: The future is blockchain and data
584.description: Hey, it’s Han and Nikki in your inbox again.
584.spr_content: 1. Introducing Han, Nikki, and a new voice for Dwarves Updates focused on engineering insights. <hr />2. Discord's #blockchain channel is highly active; driven by crypto trends and our commitment to blockchain learning. <hr />3. Increased learning notes in the Brainery validate our effort in the data landscape. <hr />4. Thanh Pham discusses preparing designers and engineers for evolving technology in upcoming years. <hr />5. Key topics: <hr />   - Future direction of data.<hr />   - Blockchain as a viable career.<hr />   - Prioritizing learning metrics.<hr />   - Updates on apprenticeship programs. <hr />6. Dwarves' 2018 focus on blockchain led to a dedicated team of 20 product developers; prediction was accurate.<hr />7. 2022's shift to data aligns with rising demand for data professionals and the salary benefits they enjoy. <hr />8. Enterprises increasingly leverage big data for strategic decisions; smaller businesses need better data organization.<hr />9. Dwarves aims for expertise in data science, AI, and machine learning; these technologies enhance data interpretation and self-learning. <hr />10. Preparing engineers with research and discussion environments fosters innovative data analysis.<hr />11. Weekly Radio Talk fosters community knowledge sharing; podcasts encourage informal discussions on data topics.<hr />12. Blockchain integrates into business decisions, creating new roles in decentralized application development. <hr />13. Insights from Ngoc Thanh emphasize blockchain's evolution beyond traditional software engineering. <hr />14. Dwarves promotes constant learning; recent community contributions amplify growth within the knowledge base.<hr />15. Brainery contributors rewarded under Dwarves Sponsorship for enhancing collective wisdom.<hr />16. Feedback from apprenticeship sessions used for program refinement, acknowledging areas for improvement while celebrating apprentice engagement. <hr />17. Launching Dwarves Hubs in Danang and Dalat for remote work communities enhances collaboration and comfort.<hr />18. Ongoing recruitment; commitment to fully remote work culture.

585.title: The Path To Growth at Dwarves
585.description: It's Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. We're here with the fifth edition of our Dwarves Updates. October has been a wild ride for us as a company. Most of our effort was spent on rethinking growth paths for our engineers.
585.spr_content: - Dwarves Updates – Edition 5, October highlights.<hr />- Focus: Rethinking engineers' growth paths.<hr />- Initial growth stages: mastering technical skills, tools proficiency, faster delivery.<hr />- Growth stalls post-early years; excitement fades, code quality stagnates.<hr />- Risk of quitting leads to repeated cycles elsewhere.<hr />- Commitment to long-term growth: providing constant new challenges.<hr />- Importance of a defined, actionable engineering career ladder.<hr />- Career ladder applicable to all; tailored action plans established.<hr />- Clear expectations for junior/mid engineers to reach senior level; seniors guided towards mastery or leadership roles.<hr />- Encouragement for open consulting ideas; value in broader perspectives.<hr />- Training engineers in consulting for diverse skills: management, marketing, copywriting.<hr />- Collaborative tech learning: team initiatives on emerging technologies.<hr />- Current trends: blockchain, Metaverse, AI & ML.<hr />- Recent successes: Cyber Neko and other blockchain projects.<hr />- Careful project screening for growth opportunities.<hr />- Favor projects that solve interesting problems, align with strengths or learning, promote team dynamics, and support engineer development.<hr />- Engineers' input in project decisions ensures engagement and alignment with interests.<hr />- Strong focus on employee growth aligns with company success.<hr />- Happy, engaged engineers produce high-quality code, leading to satisfied clients.<hr />- Commitment to continuous improvement and shared success at Dwarves.

586.title: It's a wrap: 2021 in Review
586.description: Hey, it’s Han and Nikki in your inbox again. On behalf of the entire Dwarves team, happy 2022!
586.spr_content: - Greetings from Han and Nikki; Happy 2022 from the Dwarves team.<hr />- Reflecting on 2021: eventful, full of challenges, embodying a can-do mindset.<hr />- Emphasis on trial and adaptability: "fail fast, learn often", aligned with Agile Minifesto.<hr />- Successful collaborations with clients: Setel, Momos, Mudah, Attrace, SP Group, Vietcetera, WeBuild.<hr />- Operational automation using Notion, Basecamp, and self-built Fortress.<hr />- Specialized team established for blockchain & web3 initiatives.<hr />- Focus on team development and gratitude for client trust in collaboration.<hr />- Milestones:<hr />  - Team growth to 60 engineers.<hr />  - Focused recruitment of experienced engineers in Vietnam.<hr />  - Leadership and mentoring opportunities increased within the team.<hr />  - Enhanced compensation and benefits structures.<hr />  - Issued Dwarves Token for positive contributions.<hr />  - Refined career progression paths and mentorship.<hr />  - Organized team training and learning initiatives.<hr />- Technology advancements focused on Web3, Open Internet, AI, and Big Data.<hr />  - Onboarded 6+ blockchain projects; blockchain team grew to 20.<hr />  - Empowered self-organized study groups among Dwarves.<hr />- Business direction shifts:<hr />  - Larger, selective partnerships.<hr />  - Transition towards software consulting from outsourcing.<hr />  - Engineers engaged in project and hiring decisions, emphasizing teamwork.<hr />  - Multiple operational locations in Vietnam: HCMC, Danang, Hanoi, Dalat.<hr />- Future outlook for 2022:<hr />  - Commitment to blockchain and web3 technologies.<hr />  - Intent to partner with more teams and deliver high-quality products.<hr />  - Focus on enhancing skill sets and teaching software best practices.<hr />  - Expansion of the team to find like-minded talent; invite referrals for Dwarves Careers.<hr />- Goals: exploration of various initiatives leading to innovative products and meaningful connections.<hr />- Closing with positivity for future opportunities: "Onward and upward."

587.title: Da Lat Office
587.description: It's Han and the Dwarves team again. Since June 2020, we've been planning on a new office/studio in Da Lat.
587.spr_content: - Dwarves team embodies a borderless software firm model, creating impactful products across industries.<hr />- Updates include lessons learned, team investment, and client success strategies.<hr />- New office opens in Da Lat, Vietnam; a peaceful, nature-rich locale ideal for work-life balance.<hr />- Remote-first approach proved effective during the pandemic, enhancing client communication and team cohesion.<hr />- Focused on employee well-being in fast-paced software industry, especially with shift to remote work.<hr />- Initiative launched to upgrade WFH experiences with grants for workspace improvements.<hr />- Team bonding improved through shared workspace upgrades and engagement.<hr />- Company slogan emphasizes joy in coding: “every line of code resembles happiness.”<hr />- Commitment to fostering better work conditions leads to satisfied employees and clients.<hr />- Simple actions for employee support yield significant positive outcomes.

588.title: What's New in September 2024
588.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's strides forward. September's updates spotlight the AI Club launch, rewards for our sharing culture, hybrid work check-ins, reporting tech trends in forward engineering, and our Mid-Autumn celebration.
588.spr_content: - **AI-Club Launch**: New hub focused on AI and LLM exploration; fosters collaboration and practical productivity.<hr />- **Shared Knowledge Rewards**: Emphasis on rewarding contributions to AI/LLM; current rewards up to 3-4x.<hr />- **Culture of Learning**: Monthly ICY pool ($4000 up for grabs); prioritizes AI/LLM contributions, fostering team growth.<hr />- **Monthly Contributions**: 1054 ICY distributed for various contributions; highlights community involvement and impact.<hr />- **Auto Check-In Feature**: New office automation promotes connectivity; rewards for participating in hybrid work.<hr />- **Tech Report Summary**: Q3 focus on optimizing tech tools; highlights innovations like Dify, LangGraph, and RAG.<hr />- **Mid-Autumn Festival Celebration**: Traditional observance strengthens community bonds; promotes team unity amidst work.<hr />- **Engagement Options**: Join AI-Club, participate in discussions, and share valuable insights to earn rewards. <hr />- **AI-Sheep Role**: Open for actively engaged users; encourages sharing and learning within the community.

589.title: Dwarves' 2nd community offline meet-up
589.description: At the end of May, we had the pleasure of hosting our second community meet-up. Over 50 folks, including notable community members, joined us.
589.spr_content: - Successful second community meet-up in May.<hr />- Over 50 participants, including @jack, @congiomat, @tannhatcms.<hr />- Focus on "Building a Resilient System".<hr />- Led by @hoangnguyen and @hieuthu2.<hr />- Promoted design system knowledge and meaningful discussions.<hr />- Updates on Dwarves' recent activities shared.<hr />- Casual dinner and drinks facilitated bonding.<hr />- Supportive atmosphere fostered community connection.<hr />- Positive feedback received; motivation for future improvements.<hr />- @congiomat praised content and friendliness; deemed a success.<hr />- Meet-ups held every three months to share knowledge.<hr />- Open invitation to partners, alumni, and interested individuals.<hr />- Gratitude expressed to operations team for smooth execution.<hr />- Anticipation for next gathering, aim for larger participation.<hr />- Invitation to join Dwarves network via Discord.

590.title: Weekly Digest #8: Then came the last days of May
590.description: Here's to hoping for a brighter and better month on this last day of May. We’re in the heat of a community offline meet-up today, gathering to discuss the month’s progress. Everyone's a bit busy arranging their travel to Saigon, a wild place we all call home. So, let’s dive into what we’ve been up to.
590.spr_content: - End of May reflection; anticipation for a brighter month ahead.<hr />- Community offline meet-up today; focus on monthly progress.<hr />- Members traveling to Saigon for first rescheduled event.<hr />- Encouragement for open interaction and camaraderie.<hr />- Celebration of @datpv's birthday; appreciation for positivity and fun.<hr />- Interest in astrology and MBTI; discussions on personality traits.<hr />- Excitement for Lap's wedding; family outing planned for sightseeing.<hr />- New team t-shirts in production; majority prefer simple logo design.<hr />- Gifts from Korea; acknowledgment of @huytq's thoughtfulness.<hr />- Health focus; plank exercises introduced to counteract sedentary behavior.<hr />- Community unification through shared interests; importance of niche groups.<hr />- Call for ideas to enhance community engagement. <hr />- Farewell to May; optimism for June and community growth. <hr />- Emphasis on connection and shared passions in digital spaces.

591.title: What's New in November 2024
591.description: In November, we sharpened our focus with advancements in platform engineering, introduced streamlined service packages, elevated ICY rewards for impactful contributions, and embraced key insights from market shifts, all building momentum as we gear up for our Penang retreat.
591.spr_content: - **Team's Second Brain**: Enhancing platform and data engineering for smarter decision-making and knowledge sharing.<hr />- **OGIF Weekly Sharing**: Updates to align learning with team priorities and industry trends, reinforcing continuous improvement.<hr />- **AI Copilot Tools**: Introducing advanced productivity tools designed to streamline team workflows and enhance efficiency.<hr />- **Market Adaptation**: Responding to client needs; focus on skills in Blockchain, Data, Platform, and AI/LLM.<hr />- **Business Insights Radar**: Continuous tracking of market trends for timely updates and strategic alignment.<hr />- **New Service Offerings**: Tailored service packages constructed to meet real client needs effectively.<hr />- **ICY Rewards for Knowledge Sharing**: Enhancing reward mechanisms to promote and recognize impactful contributions within the team.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Active involvement in tech events for better industry connections and knowledge exchange.<hr />- **Company Retreat in Penang**: Scheduled team-building trip to Penang from December 14-17, 2024, focusing on bonding and leisure.<hr />- **Career Opportunities**: Open positions available in Marketing, Business Development, and Full-Stack roles, seeking new talent to enrich the team.

592.title: What's New in March 2025
592.description: Last month, the team kicked off structured OGIF demos, launched GitHub Agent and MCP DB to support internal automation, finalized the ICY-BTC swap, and rolled out UI and handbook updates on memo.d.foundation. We also set a more consistent office rhythm with meme culture picking up, while the BD team tuned into regional AI and Web3 events to stay close to what's happening next.
592.spr_content: - **March Highlights:** Implementation of structured OGIF demos, new AI tools (GitHub Agent & MCP DB), and completion of ICY-BTC swap.<hr />- **AI-first Integration:** Promotion of automated workflows via GitHub Agent for pull request management and MCP DB for structured data access and real-time trend tracking.<hr />- **Team Sharing:** Introduction of OGIF demos to enhance transparency with project updates and promote cross-team learning.<hr />- **ICY-BTC Transition:** Successful launch of ICY-to-BTC swap, supported by internal guides on process and valuation.<hr />- **UI Enhancements:** Improved usability and functionality of memo.d.foundation, including NFT minting and better search capabilities.<hr />- **Office Culture Initiative:** Launched humorous tech-meme Discord channel to foster a lively office environment, transitioning to a more collaborative work setting.<hr />- **Asia Web3 Engagement:** Participation in key events to assess shifts toward sustainable, community-led ecosystems in the Web3 space.<hr />- **Upcoming Goals:** Focus on demo participation, cultural initiatives, feedback on ICY-BTC, and expansion of AI tools; exploration of further integrations for improved memo.d.foundation accessibility.

593.title: What's New in October 2024
593.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's progress. October's updates spotlight our open source initiative, boosted rewards for sharing knowledge, navigating market shifts, weekly tech insights, and a warm celebration of Vietnamese Women's Day.
593.spr_content: - **Hiring Needs:** Seeking Full-stack Engineers, Business Developers, and Marketing professionals.  <hr />- **Knowledge Sharing:** Weekly Labs OGIF sessions focus on AI, Blockchain, Architecture, Finance; rewards for contributions increased by 3-4x.  <hr />- **Open Source Movement:** Dwarves fosters innovation through OSS; contributors earn rewards for sharing libraries/tools.  <hr />- **Market Adaptation:** Emphasizing skills in AI, Blockchain, and Data to meet evolving client demands.  <hr />- **Consulting Shift:** Team dynamics adjust to client needs; prioritizing active contributors for impactful projects.  <hr />- **Lab Team Vitality:** Innovation center with higher expectations for boundary-pushing ideas.  <hr />- **Community Engagement:** Strong Discord presence for learning and connection among members and alumni.  <hr />- **Weekly Insights:** Launching Product Design Weekly and AI Digest; practical insights on trends.  <hr />- **Celebrating Women:** Honor women in the team with gifts and dinner; recognition of their contributions and influence.

594.title: 2021 In Review
594.spr_content: - Origin story: 3 engineers in coffee shops, no office.<hr />- Growth: Now over 40 clients/partners globally, 1M+ lines of code in 7 years.<hr />- Current focus: Dwarves 2.0, the next major movement.<hr />- 2021: Year of grit, changes, and challenges; embodying a can-do mindset.<hr />- Agile Minifesto: Fail fast, learn often, embrace starting over.<hr />- Key clients/partners: Setel, Momos, Mudah, Attrace, SP Group, Vietcetera, WeBuild.<hr />- Operations: Automated via Notion, Basecamp, and Fortress.<hr />- Team specialization: Blockchain and Web3 expertise.<hr />- Commitment to team: Hiring top talent, significant compensation raises, Dwarves Token rewards.<hr />- Internal initiatives: 1-1 mentoring, expanded internal training, knowledge sharing.<hr />- New tech focus: Web3, Open Internet, AI & Big Data automation.<hr />- Achievements: Contributions to client success; collaboration with tech-driven organizations.<hr />- Core values: Engineering culture, software craftsmanship, pride in work.<hr />- Team expansion: Remote work culture facilitating a borderless team of 60+, aiming to double.<hr />- Location strategy: Offices in HCM, Dalat (workcation cafe), Hanoi (upcoming).<hr />- Community building: Dwarves Discord established, reaching 200 users within 4 months; hosting weekly tech sessions.<hr />- Events: WeBuild Day 2021, Techie Story partnership with Vietcetera.<hr />- Yearly tradition: Celebrating Dwarves of the Year with $10,000 in prizes.<hr />- Recognition of team contributions: Emphasis on teamwork and personal growth.<hr />- Iconic merchandise launched for the community.

595.title: Weekly Digest #2: Walk around learn around
595.description: There are so many amazingly fun and wonderfully weird things happening on Discord, both last week and of course, today. So let’s dive in with a freshly-brewed “cà phê sữa,” of course.
595.spr_content: - Discord community is vibrant, full of fun and unique activities.<hr />- Participate and engage in the community; interaction fosters connection.<hr />  <hr />- COO @nikki's battery picture ignites lively discussion.<hr />- Unexpected twist: CEO notices 4 billion 6 VND on bread wrapper.<hr />- Simple battery sparks joy and conversation.<hr /><hr />- Hado office crew undertakes offline WALA session.<hr />- Key activity: Visit to Nha Nam bookstore for "Dune Messiah."<hr />- Surpassed 10km target; transformed outing into a bonding adventure.<hr /><hr />- Career advice from @nikki offers clarity in a changing landscape.<hr />- Framework assists in decision-making for individuals at any career stage.<hr />- Encouragement to reset thought processes for newfound perspective.<hr /><hr />- **#⛺・random** offers humorous AI-generated memes.<hr />- AI adds playful surprises, enhancing community enjoyment.<hr />- Memes serve as a source of laughter and creativity.<hr /><hr />- Gold prices hit all-time highs; triggers investment discussions.<hr />- Team explores strategies for gold vs. stock investment.<hr />- Stimulates broader conversation about financial literacy and strategy.<hr /><hr />- Celebrating @fuatto and @tay’s birthdays.<hr />- Wishes for joy, adventures, and unforgettable moments in the coming year.

596.title: Weekly Digest #4: Finding your authentic tribe
596.description: Welcome back to the #4 weekly digest after a long holiday. Those Discord channels are still buzzing with active messages. Without further ado, let’s see what I’ve got to share.
596.spr_content: - Weekly digest #4 returns post-holiday; Discord's vibrant communication.<hr />- Culture drives engagement; memes, opinions, jokes create connection; low-effort, high-reward.<hr />- Exciting new merchandise imminent; fresh t-shirts and stickers on the way; community pride.<hr />- OGIF: tradition for team alignment; concise, engaging, and collective knowledge-sharing every Friday.<hr />- Welcome new team members: @minhkek confirmed BD; @datnguyennnx intern starts journey; @jack officially joins inner circle.<hr />- Remote team fosters group activities: English, Poker, Board Games, Swimming, Running; a sense of familial connection.<hr />- Reflecting on memorable moments: celebrations, adventures, and camaraderie within the Dwarves.<hr />- Acknowledge and celebrate teammates: @thangnt, @lapnn; wishing happiness and memorable birthday moments.

597.title: Dwarves Of The Year 2022
597.description: It's been a long journey, but we've finally made it to 2022 and what a year it's been for our team of Dwarves. Countless hours of hard work and it's all paid off with our big wins of the year. Honored for all and huge congratulations for our Dwarves of 2022.
597.spr_content: - Celebrating achievements in 2022 for team of Dwarves.<hr />- Significant effort led to major accomplishments.<hr />- Total awards: ~$18,000 with notable individuals recognized multiple times.<hr />- Dwarves exemplified dedication and teamwork, creating an unforgettable year.<hr />- Collective success as a reflection of collaboration.<hr />- Commitment to producing quality products and improving employee welfare.<hr />- Anticipation for 2023, embracing new challenges.<hr />- Encourage pushing limits for greater achievements.

598.title: Summit 2024: Building bonds our way
598.description: Our first international summit took us to Penang, where remote connections turned into real-world chemistry. No rigid schedules or forced activities - just authentic moments of teams choosing their own adventures, from heritage streets to beach sunsets. See how giving people space to connect creates something truly special.
598.spr_content: - **Setting:** Penang's vibrant streets as a playground for team bonding.<hr />- **Objective:** Reconnect, recharge, create memories, fostering camaraderie.<hr />- **Team Dynamic:** Instant chemistry despite remote work; first in-person meetings seamless.<hr />- **Adventure Theme:** Crossing borders; first-time travelers share experiences, seasoned members guide.<hr />- **Digital to Physical Transition:** Discord chats evolve into real-life breakfast plans and food hunts; strong online connections manifest offline.<hr />- **Concepts Realized:** <hr />  - **Mastery:** Moments transformed into memories; storytelling through shared photos without competitions.<hr />  - **Meaning:** Choices during experiences foster bonds, enhancing group dynamics.<hr />  - **Autonomy:** Freely chosen activities; no enforced fun, allowing natural interaction and connections.<hr />- **Memorable Experiences:**<hr />  - Culinary explorations deepen relationships through shared meals.<hr />  - Cultural experiences in George Town create lasting memories.<hr />  - Adventure activities strengthen teamwork beyond digital realms.<hr />  - Beach relaxation encourages casual, meaningful conversations.<hr />- **Cultural Insight:** Connection transcends distance; online interactions can form genuine friendships in person.<hr />- **Reflection:** Space for organic connections leads to profound team growth; each memory, a thread in the team's tapestry.<hr />- **Vision:** Celebrating an incredible team culture that feels like home, fostering lasting connections regardless of physical separation.

599.title: What's New in January 2024
599.description: In this first month of 2024, we kept tap of what's brewing in the tech market, while reviewing what we went through in 2023.
599.spr_content: - **Dwarves Model**: 50% company, 50% community; knowledge sharing is central.<hr />- **January 2024 Focus**: Review tech trends & achievements from 2023.<hr />- **Tech Signal Highlights**: <hr />  - React struggles: updates lacking, core team departures.<hr />  - Rising interest in HTMX.<hr />  - "Rewrite It In Rust" (RIIR): projects increasingly migrating to Rust.<hr />  - Growth of AI-assisted productivity tools.<hr />  - Shift of LLMs from OpenAI.<hr />  - Emergence of trading bots.<hr />  - Cybersecurity prominence.<hr />- **Monthly Performance Tracking**: Top performers rewarded with $ICY.<hr />- **January Top Members**: Ngoc Thanh, Chinh Le, Cuong Mai, Tai Pham, Phat Nguyen.<hr />- **2023 Achievements**:<hr />  - Record contract renewals.<hr />  - $30k community bounty program.<hr />  - Product demos and showcases.<hr />  - Monthly top performer reward system.<hr />  - Dwarves & Techie communities now total 40k members.<hr />  - Frontend & Golang training courses saw high participation.<hr />  - 102 stories and 77 events shared.<hr />- **YEP 2023**: Unique one-day bonding and fun event; significant financial commitment to awards and environmental contributions.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Active Discord contributors rewarded; future training programs TBD; join Discord for updates.

600.title: Summit 2022: Engineering A Good Time
600.description: Having a blast company trip after 2 years of COVID, it didn’t happen in a common way. We planned our trip differently than others and designed apps for everyone to play as a way to bond as company outside physical activities.
