600.spr_content: - **Team Bonding Philosophy**: Rejects traditional methods; values authentic engagement over forced camaraderie.<hr />- **Post-COVID Gathering**: First reunion intensified focus on achievements and future goals.<hr />- **Company Structure**: Evolved from *Remote OK* in 2017 to **Remote First** operation post-COVID, enhancing soft skills for multizone collaboration.<hr />- **Team Growth**: Increased from 60 to ~100 members; highlights selective hiring for cultural and professional fit.<hr />- **Recruitment Metrics**: 400+ applications, 91 interviews, 29 hires; ~0.07% rate underscores quality focus.<hr />- **Client Acquisition**: No ads; relies on organic referrals and partnerships; growth to 6 partners, bringing in 5 projects.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Active in tech communities; growth of Dwarves Discord to 600+ members; includes diverse channels for sharing and learning.<hr />- **Company Trip Summit 2022**: Focused on creative, engineer-designed games for team building; emphasized fun, rewards, and achievements.<hr />- **Games Summary**:<hr />  - **Treasure Hunt**: Location-based scavenger hunt using a custom web app.<hr />  - **Road to Olymwibu**: Multiple-choice team competition; strategic point acquisition with fun penalties.<hr />  - **Hunger Games**: Real-time grid-based game; collects points or drinks based on encounters.<hr />  - **Enigma**: Decrypting game requiring teamwork and communication with physical restrictions.<hr />- **Memorable Activities**: Enjoyed leisure activities in Phu Quoc; focused on teamwork and shared experiences.<hr />- **Future Aspirations for 2023**:<hr />  - Engineer-driven game development for interactive experiences.<hr />  - Explore international travel opportunities post-pandemic.<hr />  - Enhanced incentives for participation and engagement.<hr />  - Create lasting memories through media documentation.<hr />- **Core Values**: Emphasizing **Mastery, Meaning, and Autonomy** in upcoming activities and initiatives.

601.title: What's New in February 2024
601.description: In this second month of 2024, we're eyeing on what's brewing in the tech market, what's happening in our community and internally, the newest topics we're looking forward to researching and putting on the field, and expanding our partner network.
601.spr_content: - **Tech Trends Overview:** Monthly monitoring reveals high-potential trends; highlights include:<hr />  - AWS Low Latency Runtime for serverless: 10x startup speed, 2x cost reduction. Key languages: Rust, QuickJS JavaScript.<hr />  - System engineering gaining importance over traditional coding due to AI integration.<hr />  - New LLM method utilizes 1.58 bits/parameter for lower computational and energy costs.<hr />  - FinOps focusing on waste reduction amid global economic challenges.<hr />  - Advocacy for memory-safe programming languages: C#, Go, Java, Python, Rust, Swift.<hr /><hr />- **Research Agenda 2024:** Commitment to technological problem-solving drives research efforts:<hr />  - 40 topics identified for exploration.<hr />  - Community-driven topic selection via nomination and voting.<hr />  - Active participation required from all Dwarves' members.<hr />  - Senior-led bounties for each research topic.<hr /><hr />- **Dwarves' Reward System:** Recognition and incentives for community contributions:<hr />  - Development of a reward system using ICY token for engagement and knowledge sharing.<hr />  - Participation in community activities qualifies for earning ICY.<hr />  - Monthly performance tracking identifies top contributors rewarding them with ICY.<hr /><hr />- **Partner Network Development:** Pursuit of collaborative partnerships:<hr />  - Seeking individuals and companies for a co-creation model.<hr />  - Average project size: $30,000; potential $2,400 commission/month per project.<hr />  - Additional benefits available beyond stable income.<hr />  - Contact Nikki for partnership inquiries.

602.title: 2020 In Review
602.spr_content: - 2019 marks 5th-year milestone; refocus on expansion and team stability.<hr />- Emphasize territory growth, team bootstrapping, and foundational resilience.<hr />- Develop team culture and identity (black zip hoodie, Dwarven totem).<hr />- Transition from few craftsmen to a diverse team across multiple countries (Canada, Germany, Indonesia, Vietnam).<hr />- Pivot to borderless software collaboration; manage remote communication challenges.<hr />- Adaptation phase begins with pandemic; focus remains on team sustainability.<hr />- Emphasize hiring only when necessary; prioritize team alignment and shared values.<hr />- Continuous tech improvement through collaboration (tech radar, team memo).<hr />- Establish internal testing framework; increase QC team size and efficiency.<hr />- Create real-time status page for project tracking; integrate communication via Discord.<hr />- Implement Radar Ring for ongoing tech education and assessment.<hr />- Position as technical partner for startups; streamline bootstrapping of new projects.<hr />- Introduce Metric Dashboard for analytics and specific domain metrics.<hr />- Upgrade CI/CD processes; enhance local environment testing with Earthly.<hr />- Consolidate knowledge and practices to instill a data-driven culture.<hr />- Focus on community contributions: Salt Cancer Initiative, WeBuild Day, Golang workshops.<hr />- Launch tech toolkit (OSS) for collaborative solutions and productivity boosts.<hr />- Begin in-house product development via Superbits.co; focus on engineer-centric solutions.<hr />- Newsletter (The NeXT Bytes) highlights future insights and lessons learned.<hr />- Strategy for 2021: maintain stability, enhance branding, and grow community through knowledge sharing.<hr />- Foster product-driven focus; engage socially through tech and community initiatives.<hr />- Continuous evolution of Dwarves Foundation aims for a resilient and impactful future.

603.title: What's New in August 2024
603.description: Each month, we release a recap highlighting key updates and progress within our team and community. August updates highlight AI tools, enhanced community discussions, the sum command upgrade, Go enterprise MOC insights, and earning dfg tokens through contributions.
603.spr_content: - **AI in Programming:** Tools like Cursor and Claude 3.5 Sonnet shift coding towards AI guidance, enabling AI-driven code generation.<hr />- **Generative Apps:** AI builds mini apps from prompts, transforming app creation process.<hr />- **Amazon's AI Development:** GenAI assistant automates 79% of code reviews, significantly reducing time and costs.<hr />- **Prompt Caching:** Anthropic's technology increases efficiency in applications needing repeated context, reducing costs by 90%.<hr />- **OpenAI’s Structured Output:** Enforcement of JSON schemas enhances data reliability in healthcare and finance.<hr />- **Frontend Evolution:** AI tools like shadcn and v0.dev accelerate UI development through enhanced prototyping.<hr /><hr />- **Community Engagement:** Monthly learning activities boost discussions and contributions in memo notes and OGIF office hours, fostering collaborative insights.<hr />- **Fortress Bot Feature:** New feature streamlines tracking of ICY contributions, simplifying team involvement.<hr />- **Key Contributors:** Recognized community and team members for substantial involvement and input.<hr /><hr />- **Upgraded `sum` Command:** Enhancements provide quicker access to summaries, highlighting key points and insights efficiently.<hr />- **Go Enterprise MOC:** Phat Nguyen details how Golang addresses enterprise challenges, showcasing utility in commercial settings.<hr />- **dfg Token Evolution:** Transition from private stock-like asset to a reward system for contributors, integrating ICY coins for earnings.<hr /><hr />- **Essential Resources and Contributions:** Continuous learning resources and weekly Go commentary maintain engagement and knowledge sharing within the community.

604.title: Happy 2023
604.description: As we enter a new year, I want to reflect on the role that software has played in my life. For Dwarves 2.x, our goal has always been to be a borderless software firm. As we move into 2022, we are one step closer to achieving this goal. We strive to operate in new and efficient ways, different from the rest. Some of us are working with our peers to help ship their software, while others are building their own projects and striving for excellence. We are all making our way towards achieving excellence in our field.
604.spr_content: - Reflection on software's role: from career beginnings to present.<hr />- Over 10,000 hours dedicated to software as engineer and project manager.<hr />- Software as integral to personal life and humanity's progress.<hr />- Software development history: <hr />  - 1940s origins.<hr />  - Babbage's Difference Engine (1822).<hr />  - Ada Lovelace's first program (1843).<hr />- Future evolution of software anticipated and vital.<hr />- Old generation's legacy, current generation's importance, next generation's potential.<hr />- Software as more than a tool or job; deeper significance in shaping future.<hr />- Dwarves 2.x vision: borderless software firm, efficiency, distinct operations.<hr />- Team collaboration on projects, pursuit of excellence.<hr />- Quote: "Coding to survive is basic, shipping software with pride is admirable, but building a software empire is truly fulfilling."<hr />- Vision for Dwarves: global presence, passion projects, enjoyable work.<hr />- Continuation of theme: Elixir technology for transformative software development.<hr />- Wishes for health and prosperity in the new year.<hr />- Encouragement for greatness in the software field.

605.title: State of Dwarves: 2024 Semi-annual Review
605.description: The past six months have been packed with many improvements to our Discord server from new standards and automation to engaging activities and rewards. Take a moment to reflect on our journey so far, and let's get excited about what we'll accomplish together before the year ends.
605.spr_content: - **Community Enhancement:** Recent strides in automation, activities, and rewards within Discord foster support for tech lovers. Reflect on achievements and anticipate future accomplishments.<hr /><hr />- **Offline Engagement:** Successful Year-End Party (YEP) initiated first offline meet-up, followed by a second in Ho Chi Minh City with 50 participants, enhancing in-person tech passion connections.<hr /><hr />- **Knowledge Contributions:** Active members, especially Long Bui Van and collaborators, generate valuable learning resources on data pipelines and blockchain interoperability.<hr /><hr />- **Collective Wisdom:** Engaging community members foster ongoing learning and content creation, maintaining vibrant server activity.<hr /><hr />- **Wiki Development:** memo.d.foundation aims for a centralized knowledge hub, promoting continuous learning and public sharing for team efficiency.<hr /><hr />- **Reward System Modernization:** ICY rewards enhanced; incentives for learning contributions and community engagements introduced, encouraging participation.<hr /><hr />- **Exclusive NFTs:** Peeps NFT collection offers internal communication access and unique member privileges, facilitating role acknowledgment.<hr /><hr />- **Tooling Upgrades:** Internal bots (Tono, Fortress, Mochi) optimize server functionality and user experience, tracking activities and enhancing recognition.<hr /><hr />- **Focus on Research:** Key research pillars (Tooling, Software Architecture, LLM, Blockchain, Coding Security) drive knowledge expansion and application of latest technologies.<hr /><hr />- **Market Awareness:** Ongoing tech radar identifies emerging trends, such as AI developments, Rust adoption, edge computing, and serverless architectures influencing tech stack.<hr /><hr />- **OGIF Initiative:** Resumed weekly knowledge-sharing sessions (OGIF) encourage team dialogue on varied topics, nurturing public learning culture.<hr /><hr />- **Dynamic Discord Roles:** Revised role structure (MMA system) reflects expertise and contributions, fostering rewards through engagement.<hr /><hr />- **Recognition of Excellence:** Monthly top performers celebrated through delivery points and ICY rewards, acknowledging team contributions.<hr /><hr />- **Strategic Insights:** Participation in Echelon Asia Summit reveals investor trends and AI advancements in APAC startup landscape.<hr /><hr />- **Internship Launch:** Welcoming new interns to enhance team capabilities and growth.<hr /><hr />- **Team Growth:** Structural promotions and new team members bolster operations and business development expertise.<hr /><hr />- **Merchandise Production:** New t-shirt and sticker designs promote community identity and pride in Dwarves Foundation.<hr /><hr />- **Future Outlook:** Celebrate past wins while maintaining commitment to MMA goals, ready for continued success in 2024 and beyond.

606.title: Dwarves Of The Year 2021
606.description: A big congratulations to our Dwarves of 2021. Apart from the team's voting result for each title, the team leads also selected the Honorable Mention and Client Endorsed, as we want to honor all of the hard work.
606.spr_content: - Team voting results for titles announced.<hr />- **Honorable Mention** and **Client Endorsed** awards selected by team leads.<hr />- Recognition for hard work and team efforts.<hr />- Voting details accessible via linked spreadsheet.<hr />- Final results determined by team performance.<hr />- Dwarves of 2021 celebrated and welcomed. <hr />- Prize selection based on title value via separate link.<hr />- Prizes limited to subtotal value ≤ prize value.<hr />- Cash redemption of prize value not allowed.<hr />- Deadline for prize selection: January 14, 2022.<hr />- Contact Duy for assist with prize input or wishlist items.<hr />- Mini merchandise set prepared for team; address input requested.<hr />- Gratitude extended to Dwarves teammates for seven years of collaboration.<hr />- Wishes for happiness and success in 2022.

607.title: Changelog
607.description: Sign up for our newsletter to stay up-to-date on our latest news, tips, and updates. We'll deliver valuable content straight to your inbox, keeping you informed and engaged with stuff happening at Dwarves.
607.spr_content: - Newsletter page: hub for industry news and updates.<hr />- Features valuable content from Dwarves' engineers.<hr />- Illustrates operations involving engineers and community engagement.<hr />- Focus on transparency and knowledge sharing.<hr />- Continuous update mechanism for audience connection.

608.title: What's New in July 2024
608.description: Each month, we release a recap highlighting key updates and progress within our team and community. July covers AI advancements, community contributions, insights from Vietnam's tech scene, new memo commands, OGIF automation, and the introduction of our hourly billing model
608.spr_content: - **Tech Signals:** Advances in AI, growing cybersecurity emphasis, and new software trends emerge.<hr />- **AI Models:** Meta's Llama 3.1 (405B parameters), OpenAI’s GPT-4o-mini (customization), Claude Sonnet 3.5 (UI dev speed increase).<hr />- **Cybersecurity:** Increased incidents point to need for robust system designs.<hr />- **Software Trends:** Focus on simplicity, full-stack development, and AI integration.<hr />- **Salaries:** JavaScript salaries drop; Erlang, Elixir, and Clojure command higher pay.<hr />- **memo.d.foundation:** New memo commands improve submissions; automation aids collaboration and reporting.<hr />- **Dwarves Tokens:** ~857 ICY distributed for community contributions in July; breakdown shows engagement in presentations, links, notes, and bounties.<hr />- **Vietnam Tech Scene:** Robust growth predicted; digital economy projected to reach $43B by 2025, highlighting investment in AI, fintech, and crypto.<hr />- **OGIF Automation:** Enhancements streamline automation process for sessions; overview of shared topics and discussions encourages participation.<hr />- **Golang's Role:** Dwarves leverage Golang for enterprise solutions; insights gleaned influence market trends.<hr />- **Hourly Billing Model:** New pricing framework promotes transparency, fairness, and adaptability in client relations.

609.title: What's New in May 2022
609.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. In May, we kicked off Apprenticeship training, and our new chalet is ready for community to visit.
609.spr_content: - **Project Update**: Partnership with Relay and Eklipse concluded; reallocating resources to balance workload.<hr />- **Workload Support**: Contact Giang or Nikki for discussions about project workload.<hr />- **Blockchain Insights**: Ngoc Thanh's perceptions shaping team dynamics; update insights and participate in study groups.<hr />- **Apprenticeship Training**: 7 new Apprentices joined; events available on Discord.<hr />- **Intern Onboarding**: 4 interns from Bach Khoa eager to learn workflow; daily progress shared.<hr />- **Data Team**: Formation led by Tom and Dung; focus on critical data insights for business development.<hr />- **Apache Spark Training**: Dung to present on Jun 06 at 5 PM; contact Tom to join data team.<hr />- **Radio Talks Recap**: Highlights available on Memo; sessions on React 18 and Remix vs. Next.js.<hr />- **Office Update**: Dalat office enhancements include rock fences, plant dividers, and standing desks.<hr />- **Blockchain Trends**: Team encouraged to explore blockchain via partnerships with Spike Inu and others; focus on smart contracts.<hr />- **Resource Allocation**: Efforts to support partnerships and align with business goals moving forward into June.

610.title: Weekly Digest #5: Endure the hardship, delay the gratification
610.description: Happy Monday, I’m here again, bringing you a lot of updates. There are big and small things brewing at Dwarves network. As we keep on crafting a better community day by day with you.
610.spr_content: - Warm greetings from Saigon; updates from Dwarves network emerging.<hr />- Community building ongoing; new merchandise in development.<hr />- Leaders attending Echelon X Asia Summit 2024, May 15-16.<hr />- Echelon X: Southeast Asia's major tech startup conference; Dwarves aims to make an impact.<hr />- Merchandise feedback collected; community voting on t-shirt design upcoming.<hr />- Weekly OGIF (Oh God It's Friday) sessions; casual showcases on Discord Fridays at 5 PM.<hr />- Recorded sessions available; appreciation to Tom for support.<hr />- Celebrated Hieu's 4th work anniversary; metaphorical toast for dedication.<hr />- Reflected on the concept of time having weight; playful reminder of deadlines.<hr />- Introduced new channel: 👑・stoicism; promoting wisdom and delayed gratification.<hr />- Quote on achieving long-term rewards through short-term discipline highlighted.<hr />- New sticker set available; suggested creative expressions in chats.<hr />- Economic discussions facilitated in 📈・econ-cafe; COO Nikki providing market insights.<hr />- Engaging community for dandruff remedies; shared tips appreciated.<hr />- Weekly digest goal: strengthen community bonds; encouragement to enjoy summer.<hr />- Reminder to keep positivity alive; don't let others steal your sunshine.

611.title: 2022 In Review
611.description: Successfully went through 2022, a year that we might say -  a new record team reached highest growth record, kickstarted community engagement, home, compliance training & individual development are speeding up, and a whole new place to call Dwarves.
611.spr_content: - **2022 Overview:** Landmark year for Dwarves; highest growth, community engagement, compliance, and individual development accelerated.<hr />- **Team Expansion:** Added 30 new members; cultural preservation through team-driven acceptance. Launched mechanisms to co-create culture with tech.<hr />- **Leadership Evolution:** Shifted to hybrid model; decentralized leadership based on contributions rather than traditional hierarchy.<hr />- **R&D Developments:** Formed R&D department; solved common developmental challenges via Feature Flags to enhance software performance.<hr />- **Learning Initiatives:** Promoted "Fastest Learners Win"; opened learning resources to the tech community, fostering skill enhancement and opportunities.<hr />- **Revenue Growth:** Achieved 198% revenue growth, positioned as a profitable entity amidst global uncertainty.<hr />- **Investments:** Focused on decentralized crypto with Console Labs; invested in blockchain projects like Chumbi and Tatsu.<hr />- **Enhanced Security Measures:** Implemented comprehensive security protocols for client protection, including device and network security.<hr />- **Gaming Department:** Established to create engaging, engineering-driven games and activities for team bonding and client interaction.<hr />- **Community Engagement:** Developed online and offline channels for sharing, networking, and collaborating; notable success with Coding Camp initiative.<hr />- **Workplace Innovation:** Introduced remote office hubs; incentivized employee collaboration with travel benefits to reinforce connection and inclusivity.<hr />- **Summit 2022:** Organized company trip and engineering games to promote team dynamics post-pandemic.<hr />- **Apprenticeship Program:** Trained apprentices transitioned to projects; senior mentors arose, enhancing leadership through structured mentorship.<hr />- **Token Launch:** Introduced $ICY for community recognition and engagement, fostering a culture of continuous improvement in tech contributions.<hr />- **Crypto Integration:** Introduced USDT salary option to align with industry trends, embracing a crypto-native business model.<hr />- **Referral Program:** Fostered growth through employee referrals, offering a unique incentive structure for successful placements.<hr />- **Future Vision Dwarves 3.0:** Aiming for an empowered workforce driven by mastery, meaning, and autonomy; focus on craftsmanship and meaningful software development.<hr />- **2022 Reflection:** A year of significant achievements and continuity; commitment to advancing technology and team growth for future success.

612.title: What's New in December 2023
612.description: In December, we launched our Consulting Team, released our finding on tech trends, and last but not least, got everyone ready to wrap up 2023.
612.spr_content: - **Company structure**: 50% company, 50% community; knowledge distribution to tech community.<hr />- **Contact**: Engage via Dwarves Network Discord.<hr />- **December milestones**: Launch of Consulting Team, publication of tech trends, preparation for 2023 closure.<hr />  <hr />- **Reporting Tech Signals**:<hr />  - Monitor tech trends monthly.<hr />  - Highlights: AI mainstreaming, WebGPU resurgence, Actor Model computing, ComplianceAsCode, nNFT standards, programming languages Rust, Lua, Dart.<hr /><hr />- **Launching Consulting Team**:<hr />  - Comprised of specialists focused on collaborative expertise.<hr />  - Emphasizes innovation, transparent communication, and creative problem-solving.<hr /><hr />- **Monthly Top Performers**: Identifies productivity via delivery points; rewards top 5 with $ICY. <hr />  - December recognitions: Nam Nguyen, Lap Nguyen, Ngoc Thanh, Jim, Hung Vong.<hr />  - Recently launched: Mochi UI library, in-house Rust game for summit.<hr /><hr />- **Dwarves of the Year 2023**:<hr />  - Tradition of rewarding impactful team members; 2023 reward pool: $25k.<hr />  - January 13th event for team celebration in Saigon.<hr /><hr />- **Performance Review**: Reviews based on both performance and career growth; 2023 theme: Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy, utilizing new metrics.<hr /><hr />- **Community Contributions**:<hr />  - Active Discord contributors rewarded with $ICY.<hr />  - Techie's TikTok: 16k followers; invites stories from the community.<hr /><hr />- **Current Opportunities**:<hr />  - Hiring for Admin/Ops and Technical Recruiter positions; contact via email or Discord.<hr /><hr />- **FAQ**:<hr />  - No internships; apprenticeship and programs announced on memo.d.foundation.<hr />  - Contributions encouraged in Discord and Bounties, rewarded in ICY.<hr />  - Regular events: Radio Talk (weekly), Tech Event (monthly), Community Call (monthly).

613.title: What's New in July 2021
613.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. July 2021 we will move toward blockchain industry and prepare for performance review in August.
613.spr_content: - **Pandemic Update:** Covid cases exceed 100k; prioritize safety for yourself and loved ones.<hr />- **WFH Gear Shipment:** Completed; enhances work environment in lieu of annual trip.<hr />- **Fleeting Notes Reward:** July 15 recognized contributors with a $1000 reward pool for submissions to the Brainery; encourages continual engagement.<hr />- **Office Hours with CEO:** Weekly remote sessions on Fridays from 4:30-6pm; open forum for questions on various topics.<hr />- **Blockchain Initiative:** Partnership with Legend of Fantasy War, an NFT game; exploring emerging technology.<hr />- **Notion OS Adoption:** All documentation migrated to Notion; organized into Index, Process, Client Portal, Changelog, and Blog sections.<hr />- **Upcoming Initiatives:** <hr />  - Embedded & IoT R&D study group led by Trung & Hieu. <hr />  - Performance reviews begin next week; prepare 1-2 page summary of accomplishments.<hr />- **Value Fit Emphasis:** Encourage personal growth, hard work, and alignment with team goals; value addition is essential.<hr />- **Hiring for Senior Positions:** Focus on upgrading team; encourage referrals within networks. <hr />- **Team Image Update:** Refresh LinkedIn, GitHub, and Facebook profiles to reflect team identity.

614.title: Digest
614.description: A collection of both our internal and external events, including the things we do with the Labs team, Consulting team, Operations, team, and the community.
614.spr_content: - Collection of internal and external events.<hr />- Involves Labs, Consulting, Operations, and community teams.<hr />- Latest Digest: source for recent updates and highlights.<hr />- Curated content: fresh articles, community discussions, industry insights.<hr />- Regular updates for relevance and timeliness.<hr />- Designed for quick catch-up on important topics.<hr />- DSQL query retrieves recent digest links and community tags.

615.title: 2024 In Review
615.description: Closing another milestone with 2024, it has been a year of building and rebuilding ,  strengthening what works, fixing what doesn't, and uncovering new paths along the way. Every milestone reached this year carries the marks of teamwork and persistence.
615.spr_content: - **Dwarves Foundation**: 50% company, 50% community; focus on knowledge sharing and AI integration.<hr />- **2024 recap**: Building, strengthening, adapting; milestones reached through teamwork and persistence.<hr />- **Knowledge-sharing**: Central to identity; 335 memo entries as structural backbone.<hr />- **OGIF sessions**: 37 gatherings throughout the year; collaborative learning every Friday, fostering idea sharing.<hr />- **Reward system**: ICY program incentivizes engagement; 6,660 ICY (~$9k) distributed, highlighting value in collective learning.<hr />- **AI tools**: Team copilots and internal tools enhanced efficiency; tools designed to tackle real problems.<hr />- **Internal tools upgrade**: Improved Discord bots (Fortress, Tono, Mochi) streamlined workflows and knowledge sharing.<hr />- **Weekly commentary series expanded**: Insights into Go, AI, product design; actionable, practical knowledge delivery.<hr />- **AI Club**: Collaborative hub for exploration of AI and LLMs; focus on practical implementations and community engagement.<hr />- **Research topics**: 40 relevant technologies explored; focus on tooling, architecture, LLM applications, blockchain, security.<hr />- **Integrations**: Connecting tools (Notion, Slack) to streamline workflows; tracking efficiency improvements.<hr />- **Community growth**: Offline meetups cultivated networking; commitment to sharing drove community engagement.<hr />- **Dwarves Open Source**: Open-source projects foster collaboration and innovation; GitHub contributions recognized with rewards.<hr />- **Market adaptability**: Shift to hourly billing for transparency; client-centric approach amidst evolving tech landscape.<hr />- **Vietnam tech ecosystem**: Aiming to connect key partners; growth anticipated in AI, fintech, and crypto sectors.<hr />- **Workplace enhancements**: Hado office equipped for productivity; flexibly designed spaces fostering collaboration and focus.<hr />- **NFT initiative**: Peeps NFT launched; recognition of team contributions enhances internal engagement.<hr />- **Sum-up**: 2024 signifies procedural evolution; aiming for continuous improvement and sustained growth in 2025.

616.title: What's New in April 2024
616.description: In this April, we're focused on memo upgrading, reward system, OGIF, internal tooling, community meetup and market report.
616.spr_content: - **Meta's Llama 3**: Major release in AI technology, enhancing self-hosted LLM applications.<hr />- **RAG Systems**: Growing trend, integrating real-time data for accurate LLM output.<hr />- **Edge Computing**: Shift towards faster, cost-effective web applications.<hr />- **Bun 1.1**: Speed and compatibility in JavaScript, introduces copy-paste UI for enhanced developer customization.<hr />  <hr />- **memo.d.foundation Upgrades**: New sidebar, pinned notes, reading mode updates for improved knowledge organization and user experience.<hr />  - Enhanced interface includes user-friendly navigation, author info, TOC, estimated reading time.<hr />  - Achievements by contributors improve rendering and coding speed.<hr /><hr />- **Tonobot & Fortress Updates**: Automation in Discord via new features.<hr />  - Tonobot tracks Dwarves Network activities, creates top contributor reading lists.<hr />  - Fortress provides real-time memo updates for user engagement.<hr /><hr />- **Monthly Learning Reward System**: Introduces ~700 ICY monthly pool for knowledge contributions, aligning with research-focused culture.<hr />  <hr />- **Dwarves Office Hour**: Weekly knowledge-sharing sessions every Friday at 5 PM on Discord.<hr />  - Recent topics include cross-chain bridging, liquid market insights, and Erlang tutorials.<hr /><hr />- **Upcoming Event**: Community meetup in Ho Chi Minh City, May 31st.

617.title: Weekly Digest #7: A journey through time
617.description: The sun peeks over the horizon, Saturday vibes and good news – the perfect combo. We're about to spice up your weekend with a recap of all the awesome things we whipped up this week.
617.spr_content: - Saturday optimism: sunlight, good news, and weekend excitement.<hr />- Highlight on open-source contributions: free GitHub Copilot subscriptions for participators. <hr />- Open-source projects enhance coding skills; collaboration enriches the experience. <hr />- Discord encounters: scam alerts regarding fake support and reported spam calls. <hr />- Emphasis on community vigilance and safety amidst digital risks. <hr />- Celebration of @anna's birthday: joy, camaraderie, and humor in the team. <hr />- Nostalgia and collective memories shared through team photos fostering community spirit. <hr />- Introduction of Monthly Community Snapshot: concise updates and visuals designed for engagement. <hr />- Reflection on two months of weekly digests: growth in writing and community connection. <hr />- Commitment to the community and appreciation for ongoing support. <hr />- Teaser for next digest focusing on an exciting community highlight. <hr />- Anticipation for continued shared stories and collective contributions.

618.title: What's New in February 2025
618.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's strides forward. February's recap covers the hybrid mode shift, ICY-to-BTC swap testing, updated use cases with AI and trading solutions, skip-level meetings, and the New Year gathering kickoff.
618.spr_content: - **Hybrid Work Model:** Transitioned from remote-first to hybrid, emphasizing scheduled office days, engagement boosts, and perks such as lunch support and transport coverage. Key tools: Office Leaderboard and workspace upgrades (Apple Studio Displays, Herman Miller chairs). <hr />- **ICY to BTC Transition:** ICY transitioned to BTC; first demo completed, swap mechanism operational. Final testing before launch announced. Core of community-driven reward system, enhancing engagement.<hr />- **Technology Trends 2024:** Focus on AI agents, blockchain innovations, automating trading strategies, and full-stack engineering demands. Key areas: AI automation, VC funding, optimized performance (DuckDB, WASM), decentralized tech.<hr />- **Engineering Case Studies:** Updated case studies showcasing AI integration across project reporting, security, trading analytics, and data management, enhancing performance and workflow.<hr />- **Skip-Level Meetings:** Facilitated open dialogue with CEO regarding challenges and operational improvements, fostering an environment for transparent communication.<hr />- **Annual Health Checkup:** Routine health screenings organized for team members, with logistical support for remote participants, ensuring comprehensive health management across locations.<hr />- **Health Insurance Renewal:** Ongoing renewal of Bao Minh health insurance to maintain coverage; updates to be communicated via Basecamp.<hr />- **New Year Gathering:** Team reunion for Tết celebrations, reinforcing community bonds and setting goals for the upcoming year, emphasizing the integration of technology and community-building.

619.title: 2018 In Review
619.spr_content: - 2018 marked a year of significant achievements and growth.<hr />- New team structure established; emphasis on cultural values.<hr />- Transitioned to a new office space.<hr />- Welcomed new team members, referred to as "dwarves."<hr />- Team size expanded from 15 to approximately 30.<hr />- Collective commitment to building a global software company.<hr />- Improved processes established for quality software delivery.<hr />- Year seen as the beginning of a new chapter; gratitude expressed for contributions.<hr />- Anticipation for continued collaboration in 2019.

620.title: What's New in December 2021
620.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. December 2022 will go over our growth in blockchain, team members, upgrade on the benefits packages.
620.spr_content: - Focus on real blockchain deals.<hr />- Opportunities for learning and exchange in #blockchain and #web3.<hr />- Onboarding Hien, Tu, and Ngoc Mai to Spike Inu and Eklipse.<hr />- Commitment to grow team participation in blockchain projects.<hr />- Selectively dropping long-term projects misaligned with business goals.<hr />- Deploying a minimum of 3 Dwarves on most remaining projects.<hr />- Increased headcount correlating with delivery capability.<hr />- New Dwarves: Cuong Mai, Tom, and Ngoc Mai complete probation.<hr />- Phat Ha leads Nghe Nhan Trading; team expansion noted.<hr />- Successful client endorsements from projects like Momos, Relay, BeaverBitcoin, and Tokenomy.<hr />- New Dwarves demonstrating immediate contribution: Ngoc Thanh (Spike Inu), An Tran (Nghe Nhan Trading), Tom (LFW BE lead), Hoang Nguyen (SP Digital).<hr />- Benefits package upgraded: salary, WFH station enhancements.<hr />- One-way tickets to remote hubs available Q1 2022; potential tech events in Da Nang.<hr />- Recognition of Dwarves of 2021 with actionable wishlist.<hr />- Feedback from team incorporated into 2022 planning.<hr />- Encourage submission of info for upcoming gifts. <hr />- Aspirations to excel in 2022.

621.title: Road To 100
621.description: 2022 matched us with the 80th Dwarves. A notable highlight, and we're ready to have more. It's not easy to find people that has the same value. It takes true & solid seeks.
621.spr_content: - 2022 partnership milestone: matched with 80th Dwarves.<hr />- Striving for shared values; requires diligent seeking.<hr />- Moving towards 81st and beyond; launching a tech-based matching mechanism.<hr />- Introducing the Dwarves Referral Program to leverage existing networks.<hr />- Team members encouraged to recommend suitable acquaintances.<hr />- Valuable suggestions sourced from ex-colleagues, university, and high school connections.<hr />- Prefer using bonuses for referrals over headhunting agencies.<hr />- Referral bonus: **2.5%** of project service fee upon successful conversion.<hr />- Bonus valid until January 1, 2023.<hr />- Calculation example: Referrer A recommends B, working on project C with $5000/month service fee.<hr />- A receives $125 monthly bonus per project on completed invoice.<hr />- Five referrals yield passive income of **$625/month**.<hr />- Introduction of Dwarves' Referral Dashboard for visibility on bonuses and leaderboards.<hr />- Acknowledgement of contributors Huy Nguyen and Khoi Le for development.<hr />- Referral from team members prioritized for higher success rate.

622.title: What's New in December 2024
622.description: December blended Penang team moments with steady progress, closing 2024 with energy and ready for what's next.
622.spr_content: - Summit 2024 in Penang: a getaway combining cultural discovery, laughter, and recharging moments.<hr />- Team experiences: street food, heritage walks, challenge courses, peace by the waves.<hr />- Strengthened team bonds through shared adventures, both online and offline.<hr />- Year-end wrapping: projects closing with care, preparing Tet gifts for meaningful celebrations.<hr />- Emphasis on reflection: capturing achievements and lessons learned from the year.<hr />- Planning for 2025: blending productivity with thoughtful resets.<hr />- Projects advancing while planning sessions for next year’s direction continue.<hr />- Year-end moments highlight team dynamics: syncing up, wrapping up old projects, and sketching new ones.<hr />- Positive energy for the new year; balancing preparation with ongoing work.<hr />- An expression of gratitude for 2024's accomplishments, emphasizing teamwork and meaningful connections.<hr />- Anticipation for 2025: readiness for new challenges and opportunities.

623.title: 2019 In Review
623.spr_content: - Reflection on growth over five years; celebration of survival against challenges.<hr />- Each individual faced personal challenges; collective achievements noted.<hr />- Membership growth: from 30 individuals in 2018 to 50 in 2023.<hr />- Evolution from youth and inexperience to a team that is still developing.<hr />- Organization's approach: prioritizing people and technology.<hr />- Transience of individuals; lasting spirit of the community emphasized.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation as a space for unconventional creativity.<hr />- Strong belief in a promising future for the organization.<hr />- 2019 as a year of both accomplishments and failures; learning experiences.<hr />- Importance of building a team based on shared beliefs and values.<hr />- Acknowledgment of teamwork and its collective intelligence as key to success—reference to Uncle Ho's philosophy without direct quotation.<hr />- Gratitude expressed for contributions from all team members.<hr />- New theme for 2020: "The borderless software firm"; anticipation of future together. <hr />- Closing with New Year wishes and optimism.

624.title: What's New in May 2024
624.description: May was our month for meetups, upgrading our monthly learning pool, launching NFT roles for our team members, onboarding new collaboration, recapping the SP Group visit & Echelon X 2024, and hosting an OGIF office hour.
624.spr_content: - **Dwarves Offline Meet-Up:** Over 50 members attended for networking, OGIF talks, and casual dinners, fostering engagement and community updates.<hr />- **ICY Rewards:** Monthly reward pool increased to $1,500, encouraging knowledge sharing for greater earning potential.<hr />- **SP Group Visit & Echelon X 2024:** Participants gained insights into Southeast Asia's tech landscape, AI influence, investment trends, and digital transformation prospects at Echelon Asia Summit.<hr />- **New Collaboration:** Partnership with Fornax AI initiated, focusing on enhancing pitch decks using AI insights and tools.<hr />- **Exclusive Dwarves NFTs:** Unique NFT roles introduced for community members to acknowledge their contributions.<hr />- **Dwarves Office Hour:** Discussions on building resilient systems featured insights from @hieuthu2 and @hoangnguyen on failure design, redundancy, and availability assurance.

625.title: What's New in January 2022
625.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. January 2022 will go over performance review and our growth on projects, new year highlights.
625.spr_content: - **MStation Overview**: Blockchain-based game on Binance Smart Chain (BSC). Players summon characters, mine daily, protect MStation, loot for earnings.<hr />- **Team Structure**: 6-member team led by Ngọc Thành, with Khai Le as part-time PM. Hiring additional members due to upselling requests. Refer candidates for bonuses.<hr />- **Performance Review Updates**: Self-review notes received; 1-1 meetings scheduled post-Lunar New Year. Results to be announced by March.<hr />- **Brainery Repo Resumption**: Cleaning up repository, developing writing guidelines, and reintroducing rewards for presenters and knowledge creators. Ops Team collecting notes.<hr />- **Profit-Sharing Policy**: Offered to team members with over 24 months of service. Reflects shared effort and contribution. More details in the Dwarves Handbook.<hr />- **Flight Ticket Policy**: Eligible for full-time members with 6+ months tenure. Four annual trips up to 2,000,000 VND/each to Da Lat, Da Nang, potentially Hanoi. Booking managed by Ops for reimbursements.<hr />- **Team Hangouts**: Monthly sponsored dinners resume, facilitating simultaneous gatherings across locations (HCMC, Hanoi, Da Nang). Full expense refunds by Ops.<hr />- **Lunar New Year Gifts**: Gift sets delivered to all team members, celebrating the past year and welcoming the Year of the Tiger.

626.title: What's New in March 2024
626.description: In this March, we're eyeing on what's brewing in the tech market, ICY updates in 2024, the first offline meetup and product demo.
626.spr_content: - **Reporting Tech Signals**: Focus on innovations in AI, APIs, tooling, programming, design-engineering synergy.<hr />- **ICY in 2024**: Updates on ICY's functionality and engagement enhancements since September 2022.<hr />- **Demo and Showcase**: Monthly events highlight product demos and showcases from Dwarves.<hr />- **Community Meet-up**: Offline events scheduled in Saigon to foster connections among community members.<hr /><hr />**GenAI Influence on Development**:<hr />- Rise of individual-led application development and prompt engineering.<hr />- Significant productivity gains through GenAI lead to enterprise adoption.<hr />- Enhanced operational efficiency due to improved infrastructure, supported by Google, OpenAI, Microsoft.<hr />- Innovations in in-app design for LLMs enhance virtual assistant capabilities.<hr /><hr />**ICY Updates March 2024**:<hr />- ICY rewards for Discord engagement, new role system introduced.<hr />- Migration of ICY contract from Polygon to Base chain for NFT/staking progression.<hr />- Linking of Mochi and GitHub accounts incentivizes user engagement with ICY tokens.<hr /><hr />**Community Engagement Initiatives**:<hr />- Transition from team dinners to quarterly offline meetups in Ho Chi Minh City for deeper community interactions.<hr /><hr />**Demo and Showcase Features**:<hr />- Introduction of Backr tool for enhanced screenshot presentation.<hr />- Weekly Solana Build Station participation offering collaboration space for developers.<hr /><hr />**Future Events**:<hr />- Upcoming offline meetup in Ho Chi Minh City; details to be announced.

627.title: Navigating changes
627.description: The last tech cycle is ending, and we're already in the new normal. We are not in the best shape to compete with certain competitors, especially with a new market meta emerging. We are now in a future of new automation paradigms via AI and assets are moving on-chain.
627.spr_content: - **Purpose**: Innovation as the driving force; desire to prioritize meaningful projects over routine tasks; aim to ship software effectively despite challenges.<hr />  <hr />- **Competency**: Intense global competition; need for exceptional talent; urgency to stay relevant and tackle complex problems; some individuals are overextended while others are underutilized.<hr /><hr />- **Facts**: Recent interest in AI and Blockchain projects was unfulfilled; resource allocation issues; ZIRP environment creates false job security; need to adapt to changing market conditions.<hr /><hr />- **Road Ahead**: New automation paradigms and on-chain asset movements define the future; shifting demand for software solutions; struggle to balance custom development against off-the-shelf offerings.<hr /><hr />- **Next Steps**:<hr />  - **Consulting**: Reassess team engagements; lack of contributions may lead to changes for those not actively involved; explore new opportunities during a transitional phase.<hr />  - **Lab Team**: Maintain focus on innovation; enhance benefits for lab contributors; enforce performance prerequisites for new hires.<hr />  - **Alumni/Community**: Strengthen relationships within the Dwarves brand; utilize Discord as a learning and connection hub; provide permanent email aliases for alumni and members.<hr /><hr />- **Recap**:<hr />  1. Innovation landscape has evolved.<hr />  2. Target customers are shifting towards AI, Blockchain, and Data.<hr />  3. Consulting requirements are under revision.<hr />  4. Non-contributing members face reassessment: limited work opportunities, tough market competition, potential breaks, adaptability timeframe of 15-30 days.<hr />  5. Team leaders to assemble their top-performing teams (A-teams).

628.title: What's New in June 2024
628.description: In June, we expanded our knowledge base on software design, LLMs, and blockchain, while actively encouraging knowledge-sharing through increased ICY rewards. Our Vietnam Tech Scene report highlighted key industry players, and weekly OGIF talks fostered discussions on diverse tech topics like design patterns, data modalities, and blockchain architecture
628.spr_content: - **Memo.d.foundation**: Focus on software design, LLM, blockchain; core of continuous learning.<hr />- **Increased ICY Rewards**: Fleeting notes amplify learning rewards; incentivizes contributions.<hr />- **Dwarves Token Usage**: ~500 ICY for community engagement; highlights from OGIF talks and tech sharing.<hr />- **Vietnam Tech Scene**: Insights on AI, fintech, blockchain; identifies key players and market trends.<hr />- **Weekly OGIF Talks**: Knowledge-sharing sessions every Friday; topics include design patterns and blockchain architecture.<hr />- **Memo Growth**: Emphasis on Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy (MMA); contributor-driven content expansion.<hr />- **Contribution Rewards**: ICY distribution for OGIF talks, Memo notes, and sharing insights; encourages participation.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Non-restrictive participation model; fostered active token utilization.<hr />- **Top Contributors**: Recognition for active participants; sparks motivation and community involvement.<hr />- **Investment Landscape**: Vietnam attracts $529 million in tech investments; sectors like Healthcare and Education grow substantially.<hr />- **Digital Economy**: Fast growth trajectory; projected to reach $43 billion by 2025 in Southeast Asia.<hr />- **Active Investors**: Nearly 100 investors, pivotal in nurturing AI, fintech, and blockchain sectors.<hr />- **Legal and Policy Support**: Encourages innovation; enhanced governance and M&A activities facilitate growth.

629.title: Weekly Digest #1: What do you stand for?
629.description: Our Discord crew is buzzing with energy after our last Friday community call, with folks sharing snapshots of their workspaces, Anna shared the movie quote and catch-up with peeps at lobby, random channels.
629.spr_content: - Community engagement amplified after Friday call; workspace sharing ignited enthusiasm.<hr />- Emphasizes digital nomad lifestyle; "work hard, play hard" ethos promotes motivation.<hr />- Authenticity fosters belonging; best work emerges from feeling at ease.<hr />- Inviting all to share their workspaces, building a sense of inclusivity.<hr />- Quote shared by UX designer Anna spurs team’s reflection on values: "What do you stand for?"<hr />- Diverse perspectives shared; curiosity, family, inner peace, and freedom highlighted.<hr />- Team embraces authenticity, delivering "100% Real" responses to personal inquiries.<hr />- Open dialogue encouraged; invites others to join the conversation and contribute.<hr />- Explore '#random' and '#lobby' channels for daily stories and positive interactions.<hr />- Community feeling akin to a cozy, vibrant virtual hangout.<hr />- Check on members like @bien and discuss @vincent's upcoming Europe trip to maintain connection.<hr />- Anticipation for ongoing conversations and community engagement next week.

630.title: What's New in October 2023
630.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. October is our month for open-source and reflections.
630.spr_content: - Dwarves functions as a 50% company, 50% community model.<hr />- Knowledge gained is shared back with the tech community.<hr />- Monthly recaps highlight significant changes and updates.<hr />- **memo.d.foundation** serves as the company wiki for operations and learnings.<hr />- Core team restructured into 5 functional teams for improved delivery.<hr />- New teams: Labs (R&D), Consulting (biz results), Console (product focus), Techie (celebrating tech), Ventures (investment).<hr />- MMA-based career development prioritizes Mastery, Meaning, and Autonomy as performance indicators.<hr />- Frontend Course 2023 saw a 4x increase in participants, indicating positive community reception.<hr />- Completed tech foundation and product development for Droppii after a 15-month partnership.<hr />- Community growth: 2050 Discord members; significant engagement in tech discussions.<hr />- Upcoming events include Golang Meetup and Techie x Webuild Summit.<hr />- Contributions to Dwarves network rewarded through Discord and Bounties.<hr />- Regular events: Radio Talk (weekly), Tech Event (monthly), Community Call (monthly).

631.title: What's New in November 2023
631.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes in our company and our team. November is our month for meetups and outstanding craftsmanship.
631.spr_content: - Labs team launched: Dwarves R&D operational; focuses on industry-changing technologies: WASM, Passwordless, Rust, AI, MPC, UI practices, Elixir, Golang.<hr />- Monthly performance tracking: Top 5 rewarded with $ICY; NFT badges introduced for staking to earn company shares.<hr />- Salary Advance program: Dwarves team can access up to 25% of monthly salary in $ICY; service accessible via Discord and <https://icy.so>.<hr />- Upgraded memo.d.foundation: Enhanced homepage, categorized and searchable content.<hr />- Community engagement: ~400 active Discord users; rewards for top contributors; bounties available.<hr />- Team recruitment: Positions open for React Native Developer (contract) and Admin/Ops (full-time); contact via <spawn@d.foundation> or Discord. <hr />- Client features delivered: Time-sensitive alarms, money transfer with Mochi, live annotations, user flows at kiosks.<hr />- Techie stories showcased on Tiktok: Life in tech narratives from the US and Japan.

632.title: OGIF Office Hours #5 - Singapore market report, C4 modelling, How we created Memo's nested sidebar
632.description: Our fifth office hours community discussion covers the Singapore market report, C4 modeling, and how we created Memo's nested sidebar. We aim to promote learning and growth within our community by sharing weekly topics, selected through tags, and encouraging collaboration among members.
632.spr_content: - Title: Singapore Market Report, Nested Sidebar in Memo, C4 Modeling.<hr />- Team introductions and meeting prep, ensuring attendance and organization.<hr />- Overview of topics, recent team activities, trading strategies by An.<hr />- Focus on upcoming tech events, networking opportunities.<hr />- Minh Le presents 5-minute market research segment.<hr />- Companies reduce costs by workforce and marketing cuts, IT sector impacts.<hr />- Discussions on product testing in e-commerce and logistics sectors.<hr />- Startups urged to limit spending; data privacy concerns influencing market entry.<hr />- C4 modeling highlights different professional perspectives; need for data aggregation.<hr />- Nested sidebar benefits for team collaboration; enhances research access.<hr />- Demonstration of new interface features and user experience improvements.<hr />- Token transfer process outlined; includes selection, confirmation, rewards.<hr />- Stacking model introduced for enhanced protocol protection and employee incentives.<hr />- C4 modeling aids in problem representation and effective system communication.<hr />- Collaborating on terminology; utilizing abstractions for clarity in system documentation.<hr />- Component functionality implementation; UML diagrams for understanding.<hr />- C4 model serves as decision-making tool, and QA framework.<hr />- CFO model for effective communication and diagramming processes.<hr />- Recursive techniques and output.js discussed for nesting items.<hr />- Discussion on menu handling and HTML rendering.<hr />- Continuous dialogue on C4 modeling applications and nested sidebar benefits.<hr />- Transitioning from plain JavaScript to Outbox for improved functionality.<hr />- Planning upcoming agenda; discussions on topic organization and quick voting.<hr />- Nested sidebar feature detailed for Memo, enhancing functionality and user interface.<hr />- Structured submission process for assigned topics emphasized for collaboration.

633.title: OGIF Office Hours #21 - Community engagement, Go weekly, Journey of thought for prompt engineering
633.description: Our latest community discussion covers key topics such as increasing community engagement, the introduction of the DFG token for contribution recognition, building an internet brand, and market trends toward AI and tech advancements. We’ll also explore small tool development for monetization and insights on reducing software development costs with new technologies. Join us to learn more about upcoming initiatives and activities.
633.spr_content: - **Meeting Overview**: Discussion on community engagement, DFG token introduction, tech advancements.<hr />- **August Activities**: Notable rise in knowledge-sharing discussions; positive feedback on ICY mechanism.<hr />- **Token DFG**: Internal stock-like token for team contribution recognition; mechanisms for earning established.<hr />- **Token Development Plan**: Transitioning to contribution-based earning; ICY coins required for participation.<hr />- **Community Building**: Focus on brand development; tokens used for internal activities and governance structure enhancement.<hr />- **AI Market Trends**: Increasing prominence of AI and tools; team adapting with AI focused projects and demos.<hr />- **Cost Reduction**: AI decreases software development costs; shift needed towards skilled utilization of AI tools.<hr />- **Open Source Projects**: Upcoming AI-related projects for problem-solving and team contributions.<hr />- **Recruitment Insights**: Market shifts impact hiring, especially in smaller firms; ongoing adaptations in large companies.<hr />- **Team Operations**: Paused consulting projects present strategic focus opportunities; new AI initiative rollouts ongoing.<hr />- **Case Study Presentations**: Emphasis on team skills development through project presentations and reports.<hr />- **Prompt Engineering**: Exploring AI-enhanced processes to create and improve prompts for effective data handling.<hr />- **Automation Practices**: Utilizing AI to streamline reporting and prompt creation; ensuring accuracy and efficiency.<hr />- **Ongoing Improvements**: Constant efforts to refine AI interactions based on user input and context understanding.<hr />- **Go Programming Trends**: Discussion on transforming Java systems to Go; community outreach via case studies and incentives.<hr />- **Encouragement for Developers**: Fostering small projects and commercialization; emphasis on individual contributions.<hr />- **Contributions and Rewards**: Plans for structured rewards to boost development activity and community involvement.<hr />- **Final Thoughts**: Importance of adapting to new technologies for software production; open discussions encouraged.

634.title: OGIF Office Hours #24 - Go weekly, AI-Driven Workflows, Holistic Team AI Demo, and Figma to UI Component with Claude
634.description: In our OGIF office hour 24 covers AI-driven workflows with Tom, a demo with the Holistic team, and Figma integration with Claude for UI components and Go commentary. Highlights include Agent Zero's data automation capabilities, Figma-to-code conversion, and the benefits of in-office collaboration for efficient knowledge transfer and AI/ML learning.
634.spr_content: - **Duration**: 85 minutes.<hr />- **Live Coding Demo**: Showcased data engineering techniques.<hr />- **Agent Zero Introduction**: Automated data processing tool, responds to natural language commands.<hr />- **Data Handling**: Focused on cleaning and analyzing CSV files, transforming raw data into structured formats.<hr />- **Visualization**: Generated infographics from backend technology data using Matplotlib.<hr />- **Figma Integration**: Demonstrated conversion of UI components from Figma to code seamlessly.<hr />- **AI Utilization**: Implemented for automation of repetitive tasks in data processing workflows.<hr />- **Team Collaboration**: Emphasized sharing knowledge among team members.<hr />- **Challenges**: Encountered UI issues, error detection and correction limitations in Agent Zero.<hr />- **Future Considerations**: Discussed the potential for deeper data engineering concepts, including MapReduce.<hr />- **Q&A Session**: Opened floor for participant inquiries regarding the demo and Agent Zero.<hr />- **Next Steps**: Planned a follow-up session to dive deeper into data engineering skills and tools.

635.title: OGIF Office Hours #23 - Go weekly, Frontend report, Hybrid working support, and AI mixture agent
635.description: In OGIF Office Hour 23 covered a variety of topics, including updates on Golang Weekly and its use in enterprise environments, comparing Go with Java and C++. The session explored the latest trends in React 19 AC, Next.js, and CSS Grid, alongside new form-building tools. Additionally, the team discussed productivity enhancements using AI-driven solutions like mixture agents, while introducing upcoming tests and hybrid work support.
635.spr_content: 1. **Financial Highlights**: Review of August performance; Golang Weekly updates.<hr />2. **Enterprise Compatibility**: Go’s readiness for large enterprises; challenges vs. Java and C++; benefits of adopting Go.<hr />3. **Tech Trends**: Updates on React 19 AC and Next.js; optimizations; CSS Grid vs. Flexbox; form-building tools.<hr />4. **Productivity with AI**: Mixture agents and EOM for learning enhancement; demos in practical scenarios.<hr />5. **Automation**: AI-driven systems for workflow improvements; hybrid work support features.<hr />6. **Team Development**: Designing AI tests for efficiency; plans for team outings and return to office support.<hr />7. **Feedback Mechanisms**: Survey on Go’s usability and challenges; community engagement on Golang blog.<hr />8. **Go Ecosystem**: Introduction of ZenKit, comparisons with frameworks like Langchain; enterprise usability and transition.<hr />9. **Market Dynamics**: Trends in programming languages; discussion about Java’s ecosystem and its comparison to C++ and C#.<hr />10. **MIx of Agents**: Automation through AI in task management; system prompts for enhanced accuracy in responses.<hr />11. **Learning Resources**: Presentation on effective techniques for learning languages and technical skills; community feedback on project methodologies.<hr />12. **Session Wrap-up**: Plans for future meetings; emphasis on hands-on projects; integration of AI in daily workflows.

636.title: OGIF Office Hours #26 - Product Design Commentary, Go Weekly, Trading App Case Study, Chatbot Evaluations, and Announcement for Essay Assignments
636.description: In this Office Hours, Nam Bui shared product design insights on the Sparkle icon in AI and onboarding, Phat covered Go tools Prep and War Zero, and Hoang discussed chatbot evaluations. Anh presented a case study on AI-driven user research for Kafi. Management announced AI essay assignments tied to the year-end trip and performance reviews.
636.spr_content: 1. **Nam Bui's Presentation**:<hr />   - Introduced the Sparkle icon's role in AI applications.<hr />   - Shared best practices for onboarding new users to AI applications.<hr /><hr />2. **Phat's Go Weekly Commentary**:<hr />   - Introduced "Prep" for compile-time evaluation in Go.<hr />   - Discussed "War Zero," a database-compatible WebAssembly runtime.<hr />   - Addressed advantages and limitations of these tools.<hr /><hr />3. **Hoang's Chatbot Evaluation Method**:<hr />   - Proposed a method using simulated users and evaluators for chatbot assessment.<hr />   - Explained the setup and implementation of this evaluation process.<hr /><hr />4. **Anh's Kafi Stock Trading Application Case Study**:<hr />   - Presented research and redesign project for the Kafi stock trading app.<hr />   - Shared user research methods, problem analysis, and proposed AI-driven solutions.<hr /><hr />5. **Management Announcements**:<hr />   - Required two essays and one practical assignment on AI: <hr />     - Essay 1: Company culture.<hr />     - Essay 2: AI applications in individual fields.<hr />     - Assignment 3: Practical task (topic pending).<hr />   - Submission deadline before the 4th week of November.<hr />   - Emphasized controlled AI usage in work processes.<hr /><hr />6. **Project and Research Updates**:<hr />   - Discussed team projects like multi-agent systems, knowledge routing, semantic projection.<hr />   - Stressed understanding and applying new architectures in software development.<hr /><hr />7. **Importance of AI in Work**:<hr />   - Highlighted the need for proactive learning to stay current with trends.<hr /><hr />8. **Job Market Changes**:<hr />   - Discussed shifts in job positions, particularly for junior and mid-level roles.

637.title: OGIF Office Hours #3 - Generative AI, Tokenomics, and Finance Talks
637.description: Our third office hours community discussion, where we'll cover diverse topics ranging from the current state of the dwarf community and their experiences with devbox, insights on and continuation of liquidity markets, advancements in generative AI technology, to fun events like a lucky draw for icy. The goal is to foster learning by sharing weekly topics suggested through tags, encouraging collaborative growth among our members.
637.spr_content: 1. **Generative AI Focus**: Emphasis on discussions about Generative AI, its applications, and implications for team projects. Technical aspects include AI, machine learning, deep learning, and neural networks.<hr /><hr />2. **Community Engagement**: Importance of community involvement and learning initiatives, including technology and finance trends.<hr /><hr />3. **Collaborative Projects**: Overview of projects and partnerships with external organizations such as Discord, emphasizing collaboration and updates.<hr /><hr />4. **Strategies for Future**: Future plans involve tokenomics, NFTs, and enhancing community support through blockchain technology.<hr /><hr />5. **Interactive Discussions**: Live discussions on liquidity, market dynamics, and technology's role in finance using case studies.<hr /><hr />6. **Technical Insights**: In-depth explanations on liquidity in markets, roles of market players, and technology's impact on market operations.<hr /><hr />7. **Iterative Feedback Loop**: Evaluating prompts and outputs through repeated testing to optimize models and meet user expectations.<hr /><hr />8. **Liquidity as a Market Indicator**: Defining liquidity in terms of asset conversion to cash and the implications of liquidity pools within markets.<hr /><hr />9. **Future Learning Opportunities**: Encouragement for team members to understand financial concepts and practices.<hr /><hr />10. **Performance Metrics**: Metrics to evaluate model performance, safety considerations, and output quality in relevance to user needs.<hr /><hr />11. **Innovative Financial Models**: Exploration of creating localized economies within organizational contexts focusing on real-time contributor earnings.<hr /><hr />12. **NFT Integration**: Plans for implementing NFTs as incentives in a token-based economy, promoting user engagement and rewards.<hr /><hr />13. **Team Involvement**: Acknowledgment of all team contributions in developing a supportive environment, with special focus on communicating project progress.<hr /><hr />14. **Adaptation to Change**: Recognition of the evolving nature of finance and technology, leading to a shift in how teams operate and interact with markets.

638.title: OGIF Office Hours #19 - Golang weekly, Designing for forgiveness, File sharing system design, Dify AI demo
638.description: OGIF 19 dives into essential topics including Go 1.23 updates, effective UI error handling, and a detailed Dify AI demo. We explore common Go pitfalls, best practices for database design, and strategies for optimizing queries. The session also features a practical demonstration of integrating AI into development workflows with Dify AI.
638.spr_content: - **Session Overview**<hr />  - Duration: 82 minutes<hr />  - Topics include Go programming, UI design, file sharing system design, query optimization, and AI workflow automation.<hr /><hr />- **Go Programming (00:06:00)**<hr />  - Release of Go 1.23 discussed.<hr />  - Common pitfalls: pass by value challenges, range loop misconceptions.<hr />  - Recommendation of an alternative WebSocket library with better guarantees.<hr /><hr />- **User Interface (UI) Design (00:17:06)**<hr />  - Importance of effective error management in UI.<hr />  - Emphasis on user-friendly design enabling mistake recovery.<hr />  - Examples from Shopify (unsaved changes alerts) and Google Drive (undo actions).<hr />  - UI support for user comfort and guidance to prevent errors.<hr /><hr />- **File Sharing System Design (00:39:05)**<hr />  - Presentation on system design covering database architecture and permission handling.<hr />  - Introduction of core components: workspace, users, assets (files and folders).<hr />  - Discussion of file path logic for efficient querying.<hr />  - Complexity of query operations maintained as O(1) or O(2).<hr /><hr />- **Query Optimization Strategies (00:47:44)**<hr />  - Addressing the significance of efficient query execution for performance.<hr /><hr />- **Dify AI Demo & Workflow Automation (01:00:17)**<hr />  - Introduction of Dify AI tools integrating AI with system workflows.<hr />  - Chatbot demonstration showcasing SQL query generation and results retrieval.<hr />  - Importance of prompt engineering for AI to deliver accurate outputs.<hr />  - Highlighting systems’ modularity and integration capabilities with APIs.<hr /><hr />- **Summary & Concluding Thoughts (01:12:16)**<hr />  - Closing remarks summarizing key takeaways from the session.<hr />  - Encouragement for further exploration of discussed tools and concepts.

639.title: OGIF Office Hours #20 - Golang weekly, Modeling dynamic object properties, Devbox demo, LLM tracing, Cursor AI editor
639.description: Our latest OGIF session covers key topics such as Go 1.23 and the introduction of Go Notebook, dynamic object modeling inspired by Notion, advanced LLM tracing techniques, Devbox demo and a hands-on look at the Cursor AI code editor. By sharing weekly topics chosen through tags, we foster a collaborative learning environment for our community to grow.
639.spr_content: 1. **Session Overview**: 97-minute session covering multiple technical topics including Golang updates, dynamic object modeling, LLM tracing, and the Cursor AI editor.<hr /><hr />2. **Golang Insights**: <hr />   - Discussion on Go 1.23 release.<hr />   - Introduction of Go Notebook, akin to Jupyter for interactive coding.<hr />   - Performance enhancements noted, particularly in local setups.<hr /><hr />3. **Dynamic Object Modeling**:<hr />   - Inspired by Notion; focus on separating model and field data using distinct database tables.<hr />   - Flexibility in adding properties via a bridge table (value table) that links tasks and fields.<hr /><hr />4. **LLM Tracing**:<hr />   - Importance of tracing in evaluating LLMs, with tools like phonic to ensure outputs align with user expectations.<hr />   - Key metrics for evaluation: latency, relevance, and accuracy.<hr /><hr />5. **Cursor AI Editor**:<hr />   - Introduction to Cursor as an AI-powered code editor, featuring code generation and project context management.<hr />   - Unique features include "comk" for editing and "coml" for chat-based support in coding.<hr />   - Limitations noted: manual folder creation required.<hr /><hr />6. **Challenges Addressed**: <hr />   - Dynamic modeling requires careful design to avoid complex relationships and ensure clarity in data handling.<hr />   - Issues with multi-organization access and field management strategies were discussed to prevent conflicts.<hr /><hr />7. **Performance & Evaluation**:<hr />   - Integration of sophisticated metrics necessary for assessing ML outputs.<hr />   - Emphasis on accuracy and bias corrections in response evaluations during live implementations.<hr /><hr />8. **Future Considerations**: <hr />   - Emphasis on community engagement with emerging tools like debox for simplifying service management without Docker dependencies.<hr />   - Encouragement for ongoing experimentation with tools like Cursor to enhance software development practices. <hr /><hr />Each highlighted topic reinforces the continual evolution in software development methodologies and emphasizes the integration of AI across tools and systems.

640.title: OGIF Office Hours #25 - Team & Community updates, Hybrid culture, Product design commentary, AI Tooling Insights, Golang weekly
640.description: OGIF Office Hours 25 covers the latest insights on hybrid work culture, AI-driven tooling and workflows, Golang compiler optimizations, and AI-enhanced design strategies. Explore discussions on AR/VR trends, voice user interfaces, AI tools for UI/UX, predictive programming, and team demos showcasing AI integrations and Golang performance tweaks.
640.spr_content: - **Hybrid Work & AI Projects**: Promote office attendance for knowledge sharing and engagement; reward with ICY.<hr />- **Regular Demos**: Tom leads tutorials on Golang, AI, Product Design, and AI tools.<hr />- **December Company Trip**: Plans for Penang trip; details to follow via Inno/alert channels.<hr />- **Product Design Trends**: Focus on Voice User Interface (VUI), Augmented/Virtual Reality (AR/VR), Modular Design structures, and AI tools for UX/UI.<hr />- **Golang Insights**: Discussed register allocation, BBQV vector index, and GUI libraries.<hr />- **YouTube Transcription Automation**: Utilizing Whisper API for audio-to-text transcripts.<hr />- **Newsletter Bot Functionality**: Collects and scores newsletter content using ChatGPT for relevance.<hr />- **AI Tool Integrations**: Summarizes content from Discord & Twitter using programmed API tasks.<hr />- **Technical Issues Addressed**: Discussed API troubleshooting, performance enhancement suggestions, and event wrap-up.<hr />- **Future Learning Sessions**: Continuous training on AI and related technologies; upcoming demo schedules established.

641.title: OGIF Office Hours #28 - Golang sync.Map, Generative AI UX design patterns, Yelp's AI use cases, Design patterns in LLM application, and Dify github analyzer
641.description: OGIF Office Hours #28 covered Go Weekly #16 by Phat on sync.Map concurrency, Nam's Product Commentary #4 on Generative AI UX design patterns, Dat Nguyen's presentation on Yelp's AI use cases including recommendation systems, Hoang's discussion on LLM application design patterns, and Cat's demonstration of a Dify-based Git repository analysis tool.
641.spr_content: - **Go Weekly #16**: <hr />  - Phat's focus: Concurrent data structures in Go, specifically `sync.Map`.<hr />  - Key points: Structure, use cases, performance trade-offs (high-read, low-write scenarios), garbage collection issues reported by the Go team.<hr /><hr />- **Generative AI UX Design Patterns**:<hr />  - Nam’s insights on integrating AI into UX design.<hr />  - Discussed System Scope Relationship, Spatial Relationship, and Functional Relationship.<hr />  - AI's role varies: from component to ecosystem.<hr /><hr />- **Yelp Use Cases for AI**:<hr />  - Dat's presentation on practical applications of AI at Yelp.<hr />  - Use cases: Recommendation systems, text editing (spam detection), image summarization (Clip Model), dataset generation, and short video review automation.<hr /><hr />- **LLM Design Patterns**:<hr />  - Hoang’s introduction of design patterns for LLM integration.<hr />  - Key patterns: In-context learning, data preprocessing/editing, multi-agent collaboration.<hr />  - Focus on enhancing LLM functionality through structured interactions.<hr /><hr />- **Dify Git Analyze**:<hr />  - Cat demonstrated a tool for Git repository analysis with Dify.<hr />  - Functionality: Content scraping, code structure diagram generation, optimizing knowledge retrieval in large datasets.<hr /><hr />- **AI Integration in UX**:<hr />  - System Scope: Multiple levels of AI integration, from small component to full applications.<hr />  - Spatial Relationship: Proper placement of AI within UIs enhances user experience.<hr />  - Functional Relationship: AI's interaction with other features, ensuring seamless user workflows.<hr /><hr />- **Design Methodologies**:<hr />  - Six methods for AI feature presentation: Separate, Alongside, Layer, Integrated Parent, Integrated Child, Point.<hr />  - Functional integration explained through six methods: Separate, Aware Of, Acting Up, Feature Incorporate, Usage, and Usage Conventionally.<hr /><hr />- **Application of AI in Practice**:<hr />  - Use of AI tools: Reflection for optimizing outputs, tools for external data access, planning for complex tasks, multi-collaboration in task execution.<hr />  - Efficiency through in-context learning and data preprocessing for optimal model performance.<hr /><hr />- **Insights from Presentations**:<hr />  - Importance of understanding AI application in products for enhanced user experience.<hr />  - Debate on potential pitfalls of using `sync.Map` for concurrent operations versus manual implementations.<hr />  - Recognition of evolving demands in the software market influencing team dynamics and project focuses.<hr /><hr />- **Team Development and Goals**:<hr />  - Upcoming emphasis on assessments to enhance team dynamics.<hr />  - Calls for clarity in project goals and outputs, especially as market demands evolve.<hr />  - Plans for further integration of advanced technologies and methodologies in project designs.

642.title: OGIF - Oh God It's Friday
642.description: OGIF (Oh God It's Friday) is our weekly casual office hours meeting, where team members unwind, share updates, and connect in a relaxed environment at the end of each work week.
642.spr_content: - OGIF: "Oh God It's Friday" - weekly technical deep-dive for engineers.<hr />- Focus: Present complex problems, discuss solutions, explore relevant technologies.<hr />- Activities include dissecting bugs, analyzing performance issues, evaluating new tools and frameworks.<hr />- Purpose: Leverage team expertise, foster collaborative problem-solving, and promote knowledge sharing.<hr />- Informal format, yet substantive content.<hr />- Topics range from optimizing database queries to implementing machine learning models in production.<hr />- Essential for continuous learning, staying updated on industry trends and best practices.<hr />- Latest OGIFs accessible via a database query for recent entries.

643.title: OGIF Office Hours #22 - Hybrid working, Tech market report, Go commentary weekly, AI demo for Go weekly content production.
643.description: In OGIF 22, we talked about Devbox progress, GReader updates, and using libre chat for artifact management. We also cover optimizing AI system prompts, Go commentary, and key market trends. Plus, we discuss how hybrid work can boost team collaboration and productivity. It’s all about practical tips and knowledge sharing to keep everyone up to speed.
643.spr_content: - **Office Changes**: Hybrid working model implemented; office improvements for better focus; optional in-office work for social connection and productivity.<hr />- **Market Report & Project Updates**:<hr />  - Transition from DynamoDB to MySQL discussed.<hr />  - Debox as a development environment, not deployment.<hr />  - New tools highlighted: Script for Go, integration with Relay App, accessibility design in Figma. <hr />- **AI Tool Demonstrations**: <hr />  - New AI tools like CR 3.5 and Sonnet for system upgrades.<hr />  - Integration of AI in real applications (e.g., automation of report generation).<hr />  - Improved artifact features in AI conversations.<hr />- **Go Programming Updates**: <hr />  - Introduction of telemetry features in Go CH for usage tracking.<hr />  - Error reporting tool for better bug tracking.<hr />  - Personalization of workspace encouraged for hybrid workers.<hr />- **Engagement Strategies**: <hr />  - Daily check-in rewards.<hr />  - Audience encouraged to engage with new tools and share best practices.<hr />- **Future Directions**: Anticipation of reduced AI service costs and continued integration in software development processes.<hr />- **Team Collaboration**: Emphasis on personal connections and collaboration to enhance team productivity.<hr />- **Feedback Mechanism**: Regular updates to improve quality and engagement; exploration of using AI and automation in documentation and application development.

644.title: OGIF Office Hours #27 - Go Weekly, Frontend Report Sep, UX Guide to Prompt with AI, Computing the Union of Two Finite Automata
644.description: In OGIF office hour 27, covering presentations on UX Guide to Prompt with AI, computing the union of finite automata, and other topics including Go Weekly and Frontend Report for September.
644.spr_content: 1. **Nam's Presentation: "UX Guide to Prompt with AI"**<hr />   - Highlights AI-human interaction trends and LLM use.<hr />   - Introduces the "RACE" method (Role, Action, Context, Expectation) for effective prompting.<hr />   -
